Mary is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school while two are grown-ups. She lives in her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

Mary operates a grocery stall selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereal shop in the near future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Mary wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa is a hard-working woman who strives hard to better the lives of her children through her good work. She has managed to pay school fees for her children out of the profit that she has earned. 

In addition to the business in her previous loan of selling fresh water, Selfa has a business selling cooked food at the market. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of Kshs 30,000 to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for food preparation. Selfa appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for food preparation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 to 20 years. She describes herself as patient. She operates a farm where she rears dairy cows, pigs, and poultry. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area for business. Her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is bad weather affecting her livestock. 

Mary will use the Kes 60,000 loan to add poultry and pigs and to buy animal and poultry feeds. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier of farm products within fiveyears. She hopes that in the future, she will earn more profits and improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add poultry and pigs and to buy animal and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman with children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Juliana sells cooked food from home to the general public. In her business, she faces the major challenge of seasonality and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, Juliana wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, tomatoes, potatoes and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, tomatoes, potatoes and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima operates a business selling clothes at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by the seasons. 

With the loan that Halima is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married mother with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

Florence operates a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In her business, she faces the major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Florence wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married, and she owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothing sales business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her neighbors, town dwellers, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, Mary wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Frank Veiko

texts.es:
Frank tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial, y trabaja desde muy joven como ayudante de mecánica, ya que debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyarlos. Frank trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes de manera diaria; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque e smuy empeñozo y sobre todo responsable.

Frank esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para poder iniciar su negocio de mecánica, y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar de mejor manera a su familia, asi el podra seguir esforzándose por realizar su mas grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de mecánica y poder tener un taller muy grande”.
texts.en:
Frank, 21, lives in the city of Imperial.  He has worked as a mechanic assistant since he was young.  His parents didn't have very many economic resources so he had to work to be able to support them.  Frank works about nine hours a day and can serve up to 25 people.  He believes he's getting ahead because he's very diligent and responsible.

Frank's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy tools to start his repair business.

This way he'll improve his income and better help his family.  He'll be able to continue making the effort to realize his biggest dream: "To study to be a mechanic and be able to have a very big shop."

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn’s group consists of two women and one man. They are originally from Teshie-Accra, a place located on the coast. Due to a lack of financial resources the gentleman completed only primary school through sixth grade. The two women were not able to attend school, as they were obligated to work at a young age. These individuals, however, are known for being hardworking, responsible and having the drive to succeed. In their free time, they enjoy being with their children and family.

Evelyn sells fried fish in large quantities to her customers. She works at her business approximately twelve hours each day and enjoys it very much. She currently sells two cartons of fish, which she finds is not sufficient to cover her customers’ needs.

Therefore, Evelyn is applying for a 400 GHS loan through ID Ghana to buy extra cartons of fish to fry and sell to her customers. Evelyn and her group are grateful for the assistance Kiva lenders provide so that they can work to better their lives.

loans.use: to buy extra cartons of fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry. She is applying for a 1300 USD loan through NOVICA to invest in a bulk purchase of natural gemstones and silver for production. She has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

Sandra works alongside her mother, Lily, who is also pictured. Joined not only by family ties in common, they share a passion for art. Both are self-taught. Their work designing and crafting jewelry is a constant source of inspiration, and both find motivation in the inner peace they feel as they create. Their designs search to transmit and share the positive energy they receive from the natural gemstones.

Sandra says, "We would like to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts for supporting us through your microcredit. May God bless you."

Use the link below to view Sandra's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4395

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and silver for her jewelry production

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of 2 children.  Both are too young and are fully dependent upon their mother.  Her husband owns a clothing business where he buys fabrics from wholesalers and sells them to retailers.  He has a lot of customers who like to buy fabrics from him.  Sometimes he purchases fabrics from outside of the city at low cost and sells them to retailers.  He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his fabrics to other retailers, which creates advertisement.

Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day.  However, he does not have sufficient funds to buy more fabrics.  Therefore, Shamshad requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand.

She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.  She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business.  Shamshad hopes that the savings will increase and that she will be able to complete the remaining construction of her house. 

Shamshad dreams for the bright future of her children, for the establishment of the business, and for a better living standard for her family.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 35-year-old woman and a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is married with four children, who are all in school.  Margarita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Margarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fouras

texts.en:
Fouras is a 34-year-old Iraqi client who is married with 2 children.  He provides the family income while his wife takes care of their children.

Fouras owns a small café where he provides customers with fast food and beverages.  He established his business in 2010.  It grew fast with experience, since he is the only person with such a profession in the neighborhood.  Fouras now has a hired employee and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Fouras is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD.  He will use this loan to renovate his cafe.  Fouras believes that this loan will positively affect his income, as it will attract more customers.  By the increase in profit, Fouras will be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his café.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en: Leopoldo is a dairy farmer who is currently in the process of modernizing his farm.  He sees Sistema Biobolsa as the perfect addition to his project.  By investing in a 20 cubic meter biodigester, he will improve waste management on his farm in addition to realizing savings in energy and fertilizer inputs. The digester will treat his cow waste to produce renewable biogas and biofertilizer, thus allowing him to displace the less sustainable, fossil-based alternatives.  This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fanta.  She is widowed with 3 children ages 25, 20 and 18 years old.  In 1990, Fanta established her frozen fish business.  She began her business to help her husband with some responsibilities.  Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women.  Working 7 days a week and 10hrs per day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL per month.  

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Fanta requires a loan in order to purchase more cantons of fish to sell.  She hopes that this loan will support her.  In the future, Fanta plans to erect a house and to get more profit.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has 3 children, ages 11, 9, and 6 years old.  In 2002, Abdulai established his meat, provision, and drinks business.  He began this business because he wants to take care of his family.  His business is located in the outskirts and his main customers are the general community.  Working 7 days a week, and 15hrs per day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Abdulai requires a loan in order to purchase more provisions to sell.  He hopes that this loan will support him.  In the future, Abdulai plans to educate his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and drinks.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ramatu.  She is married and has 3 children, ages 21, 18, and 14 years old.  In 2008, Ramatu established her cosmetics and cell phone business.  She began her business because she wants to become self-employed.  Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are young men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL per month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Ramatu requires a loan in order to buy more new cell phones and durable cosmetics stock for resale.  In the future, Ramatu plans to establish her own shop, to build houses, and give a quality education to her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones and cosmetics.

loans.name: Buena Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yusleny is the coordinator of her group, called Buena Fe (Good Faith) 1, 2 & 3.  This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.  She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and their three children.

Yusleny has been selling household goods for almost six years.  She started out with a small sum of money that her partner gave her.  She says that her most difficult challenges are selling her products on credit and then collecting on them.  Despite these difficulties, she continues to enjoy doing business.

Yusleny is excited to be taking out her eleventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and having grown her business.  She will invest her loan to buy more goods to sell, especially household and cosmetic products.  Yusleny will use her profits to invest in her business and to provide for her family expenses.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy household and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Isha.  She is married and has 3 children, ages 30, 25, and 20 years old.  In 1990, Isha established her frozen fish business.  She began her business because she wants to help her husband with responsibilities.  Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month.  She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Isha requires a loan in order to purchase more cantons of fish to sell.  She hopes that this loan will support her through its proper use.  In the future, Isha plans to erect a house and to earn more profits.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online.  As a result, her husband appears in the photo on his chicken farm. 

Hana is a 55-year-old, married woman from Gaza city.  She is a mother of two sons and one daughter.  Hana lives with her husband and children in a very simple house in the city.  For the past seven years, Hana and her husband have been raising chickens in order to sell their meat in their store. It is a profitable project but needs more money to be improved. 

Hana took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help Hana and her husband to buy more chickens and feed to develop the family business.  This will increase the productivity and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and feed to develop the family business.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  dos hijos en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Mayra lleva  6  años de tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños como blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos y ropa interior, y también confecciona ropa de vestir por pedidos. Ella ha mantenido su negocio con la inversión de varios préstamos. En busca de obtener otros ingresos ha decidido con su esposo iniciar la reparación y venta de repuestos para bicicletas. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es el quinto ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar accesorios y repuestos ( llantas, rines, balinera, parches, etc.)para reparación de bicicletas y venta de repuestos, este nuevo negocio le va generar otros ingresos y va ayudar a su esposo y familia. El objetivo es mejorar su condición de vida a través de sus actividades de negocio y poder darles un buen estudio a sus hijos y poder hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mayra is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Arizona, Atlántida. For the past six years, she has been in the business of selling clothes for women, men, and children such as blouses, trousers, shirts, T-shirts, dresses, and undergarments. She also produces clothes that are made to order. Mayra has maintained her business by investing several loans.

In order to generate additional income, she and her husband decided to open a shop where they repair bicycles and sell spare parts. The loan she is currently requesting is her fifth transaction and in the amount of 13,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy accessories and parts (tires, rims, ball bearings, patches, and other items) for repairing bicycles and to offer for sale. This new business will generate more income, which will help her husband and family.

Her goals are to improve her living conditions through her business activities, provide a good education for her children, and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, ball bearings, patches, and other items to sell and to use for repairing bicycles.

loans.name: Kati

texts.es: Kati, está casada y tiene una hija de 13 años, con quien vive en su casa propia. Kati se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, este trabajo lo realiza en su casa. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado y realizar las compras de los productos como pollo; verduras y algunos tubérculos; cuando vuelve saca los productos a la vereda de su casa y empieza con la venta; lleva más de 05 años en esta actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia nada de conocimiento para este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para poder tener contentos a su clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades, espera poder seguir trabajando y hacer crecer a su negocio para así mejorar su economía. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 900 soles, comprará mas productos comestibles para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Kati's married and has a daughter, 13, who lives with her in her own house.

Kati makes a living selling food products in her house.  She gets up early to go to the market to buy products such as chicken, vegetables, and some tubers.  When she returns she takes the products to the sidewalk of her house and begins to sell.

She has done this work for more than five years with the help of her husband.  In the beginning it was a little complicated because she didn't know anything about the business.  In time, however, she learned, and now she has the routines to be able to keep her customers happy.

What she likes about her job is she can use her time to do other things.  She hopes to be able to continue working and make her business grow so she can improve her finances.

This is her second Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 900 soles [PEN] she'll buy more rice, sugar, vegetables, and other food products for her store.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ají, venta de taris, venta de abarrotes, venta de cereales tostados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de aji; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su hermana, empezando con un poco capital y es por esa razón que requiere aumentarlo ahora.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aji) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Pinos” (The Pine Trees) is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of Alto Lima. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Virginia is the President. 

The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are a neighborhood store, selling chili peppers, selling palm wine, selling tools, and selling toasted cereal. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses, one of which Virginia belongs to. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a promoter from the organization who came to visit her. 

Currently, she has a business selling chili peppers. She says that she learned this business from her sister, starting out with a little working capital. For this reason, that she needs to increase it now. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her working capital (purchase chili peppers) that she will obtain in bulk from the traditional markets. Later, she will sell them in her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has five children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans and the health care.

loans.use: to purchase chili peppers.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo. 
Ghada is a 31-year-old mother of three sons and one daughter. For the past year, Ghada's husband has been selling fruits and vegetables on a small cart in the local market. This is the only source of income for the family. This income is not stable because fruits and vegetables are seasonal and sometimes have to be imported from outside Palestine. 
Ghada took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell in the local market.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Morad

texts.en:
Murad is a 27-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin city.  For the past five years, Murad has been working in a store selling mobile phones. Murad and his brothers cooperate to pay the family expenses. Murad wishes to improve his store so his income will be improved
Murad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more modern mobile phones and resell them. This will improve his store and also his income 
Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more modern mobile phones and resell them

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He is an employee in the public sector and earns a low income. Mohammad would like to improve himself by registering at a university and completing studies he could not complete before because of very bad economic conditions. 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop to help him in his upcoming studies at the university. This will insure him a better job and a better future.
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help him in his upcoming studies at the university

loans.name: Ebelym Osiris

texts.es:
Ebelym es una joven de 21 años de edad, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijas las cuales viven bajo su mismo techo. Ella en compañía de su esposo tienen una propiedad la cual esta cultivada con café lempira un producto de buena calidad y competitivo en el mercado para los diferentes intermediarios y compradores de la zona. Además de especializarse en la siembra y cultivo de café ellos en temporada de invierno siembran maíz y frijol y los clientes pata este producto son una empresa de la comunidad la cual se especializa en la compra de granos básicos de buena calidad para su exportación. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra la cual está ubicada a una distancia de un kilómetro. 

Hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales planea darle mantenimiento y mejora a sus cultivos con los cuales al final de la cosecha espera obtener un ingreso por venta esperado.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder darle mantenimiento a su casa de habitación como repello, pulido entre otros que son necesarios para evitar enfermedades respiratorias o alérgicas por la humedad para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Ebelym is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is a farmer, housewife, and the mother of two daughters who live with her under the same roof. Ebelym and her husband own property on which they cultivate Lempira coffee, a product that is of good quality and competitive in the marketplace since there are different brokers and buyers for it in the area. In addition to specializing in coffee production, Ebelym and her husband grow corn and beans in the winter. The customers who buy these products belong to a community enterprise that specializes in acquiring basic grains of good quality for export. Their parents taught them how to work their land, which is located one kilometer away.

Today she is seeking a loan in order to buy farming supplies for maintaining and improving her crops. At the end of the harvest, she hopes to generate an income from her expected sales. Her future plans include maintaining her house by whitewashing it and waterproofing other parts in order to avoid respiratory illnesses and allergies caused by humidity. This will preserve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in order to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: La Alternativa 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Alida is one member of the 10-person group, La Alternativa 1, 2, 3 & 4. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Alida, like all in this group, decided to do business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her house. Alida is a divorced mother of three children. She is running a sales business where she sells different products like cosmetics, shoes, accessories, and clothing. 

Alida started her business with her first loan from Esperanza, and this activity allows her to support her family. With this loan, she will invest in her business by buying more of those products. Her future plans are to have a wholesale store, to have enough money to meet her children'sr needs, and to pay for their advanced studies. 

Alida joined Esperanza almost nine years ago and this is her 16th loan. All previous loans have been repaid and invested in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like shoes, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 23-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. His mother works for a private company and gets a fair income. Zaher is still a student in his last year, studying at the social and family development college. Zaher is very determined to complete his studies with good marks so it will be easier for him to find a good job in the future. 
Zaher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop to help him in his studies at the university. Zaher will be able to do his reports and homework very easily and efficiently.
Zaher appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help him in his studies at the university

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 45-year-old mother of two from Rameh. She studied cosmetology. After surveying her village and learning of the need for a cosmetics salon, Lubna opened her business. She provides excellent services and treatments that are not available anywhere else. Lubna is known for her warmth and the caring environment she provides her clients.

Lubna needs this loan to purchase an artificial nail set and facial treatment machine, and to pay for repairs and an addition to her laser machine, acupuncture table, and chair and treatment materials.

Lubna is working to one day open a cosmetics and hair styling school with her sister to train others.

loans.use: To assist with purchasing an artificial nail set and facial treatment machine, and to pay for repairs and an addition to her laser machine, acupuncture table, and chair and materials.

loans.name: Chek's Group

texts.en:
Chek, aged 34, lives in a rural village of the Sangke district has three children; all of them are still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava. They have been in this business for ten years. She can earn about 17,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
This is the micro loan for Chek with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chek is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy est une commerçante de profession qui évolue dans la transformation de l'arachide en huile végétale. Elle est âgée de 39 et a une expérience de plus de 7 ans dans cet activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. Amy est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Avec ce prêt elle voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. A l'avenir Amy souhaite faire de l'embouche pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Amy is a trading professional who transforms peanuts into vegetable oil. She is aged 39 and has an experience of over 7 years in this business. 

She starts her day at 9 am to finish at 6 pm. Amy is married and a mother who helps her husband in managing daily expenses and her children's tuition. 

With this loan she wants to increase her stock of goods in order to meet  her customers' needs. In the future Amy wants to start fattening livestock to increase revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy peanuts to transform into oil for resale

loans.name: Julienne's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé 4 femmes qui sont toutes amies et voisines depuis de nombreuses années, certaines mêmes depuis leur naissance.

La représentant du groupe, Julienne, a 40 ans et est marié avec Barthélemy un cultivateur.
Depuis 25 ans, elle achète du maïs et des noix de palme au marché de sa ville pour les transformer
Avec le maïs, elle fait de l'Akassa (une pâte très populaire au Bénin), et elle produit de l'huile de palme à partir des noix.
Elle revend ces produits à son domicile et son stand est connu pour son bon accueil.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle en est a son 8ème, les autres ayant étaient tous remboursés sans problème, elle compte développer son activité en achetant plus de provisions et répondre à la demande de sa fidèle clientèle en se procurant des poissons et du gari (farine de manioc).

Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de développer son épargne pour, un jour, acheter sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of four women who have all been friends and neighbors for many years, some even since their birth.

Giulia, the representative of the group, is 40 years old and married to a farmer named Barthélemy. For the past 25 years, she has bought corn and palm nuts in her city's marketplace to be processed.

With the corn, she makes Akassa (a very popular paste in Benin), and she produces oil from palm nuts. She sells these products at her home and her stall is well known for its warm welcome.

With this new loan, which is her eighth, having repaid all the others without problems, she plans to develop her business by buying more supplies and meeting the needs of her loyal customers by purchasing fish and gari (cassava flour).

The profits generated will enable her to develop her savings and one day buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: buy corn and palm nuts to make Akassa and palm oil

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Mom, 44, has five children. Mom and her husband have been raising cows and working for others for a fee; her husband is also a construction worker to earn more income for the family. Having been in these businesses for 20 years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
Mom has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and has completely repaid the loans, which have helped her improve livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for another loan to buy construction supplies for her husband's business. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to improve her living lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Ms. Bayarsaikhan is the only child who studies in local private university to attain a bachelor's degree. Her major is in accounting and economics due to her thought that every organization has to have a professional accountant who is able to understand economic changes. She is so hard working and is a passionate student. In addition, she helps her mother's business during the summer break. The semester that is about to start is her final semester and it is quite important to her and her life. Therefore, in order to fulfill her dream, she is requesting MNT 630,000 to pay her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Thov's Group

texts.en:
Thov, 41, lives with his wife and three children in a village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Cambodia. One of his children is still in school. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for almost eighteen years. The current business earns him about 33,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
Thov has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, he has managed to improve his livelihood. He is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to increase his family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 38 años de edad , es madre soltera de dos hijas de 18 y 03 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Norma se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un restaurante muy concurrido en su casa en donde trabaja desde hace 13 años. Tiene la ayuda de dos personas a quienes contrata por la demanda que tiene su negocio y ella no se abastece ella sola. Está muy contenta con su negocio, pues le permite dar trabajo a personas que desean generar ingresos para su familia, además que le permite estar a lado de sus hijas quienes aun la necesitan. Tiene muchos clientes, esto le permite mejorar sus ingresos cada día, espera poder mejorar la infraestructura de su local, además de poder hacer crecer su negocio y vender mayor variedad de platos de comida a sus clientes. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 nuevos soles, comprara ingredientes e insumos tales como arroz, menestras, huevos, pollo, entre otros.
texts.en: Norma, 38, is a single mother of two daughters who are 18 and 3. They live together in their own home. Norma works selling food. She has a very popular restaurant in her home where she has been working for the last 13 years. She has two people helping her who she has hired because her business is very busy and she cannot run it alone. She is very happy with her business since it allows her to give employment to people who want to earn income for their families, and in addition it enables her to be near her daughters who still need her. She has many customers and this lets her increase her income every day. She hopes to be able to improve the infrastructure of her premises, as well as to be able to make her business grow and sell a greater variety of food dishes to her customers. This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead. As well, she promises to make her payments punctually. With the 800 nuevos soles that she is seeking, she will buy ingredients and supplies like rice, legumes, eggs, chicken, etc.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, legumes, eggs, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
A mother living in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sokchea is 31 years old and has two children. They are dependents and still in school. Sokchea is a farmer who grows rice and cassava. To supplement the income, her husband works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 11 years, earning about 94,000 KHR, but is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

Sokchea is the fourth cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her farmland so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married with seven children and lives in Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale while her husband is a farmer and a part-time carpenter. Their income is not enough to send their children to school, so Erlinda decided to improve her piggery to gain more revenue. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair the livestock shelter. She is thankful with this loan that her plans for her piggery will be successful. She hopes to gain more income to have a better living condition in the future.

loans.use: to repair the livestock shelter for her piggery business.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol, 52, is from a rural village located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. He is married with seven children, two of whom are still in school. He and his wife earn a living by planting rubber and selling grocery items. He and his wife have been in this business for 25 years.
Thol is just with VisoinFund for this cycle. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items to resell. He hopes to make more income from his current businesses so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Eam is aged 47 years. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming rice and planting pineapple for five years. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 
Eam is just with VisionFund this cycle and she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: 12-03-03 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Liệu is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. Liệu is 63 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 12-03-03 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. Because her child is grown up, Liệu supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liệu first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Liệu has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Liệu faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Liệu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to find a good job, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase drinks for resale.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 48, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She has two children who help her in managing their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzviminda operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She earns a minimum of PHP 11,500 in sales monthly.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will utilize the loan for the repair and maintenance of her house for rent.

Luzviminda dreams to have another house rental and hopes to be in good health always. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her house for rent.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 38, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bilmoret, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Raquel offers manicures and pedicures. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She also does home services. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her business. 

Raquel hopes to have a parlor or a salon and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is 34 years old. She is happily married to Robert who works as a lead man. God has blessed them with two loving children and both of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Analyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and  is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. She also sells rice. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 700 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Analyn desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Humbelina mujer de 53 años de edad, soltero, con un hijo de 31 años, su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 7 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución desde hace 2 años. El crédito lo solicita para comprar carne de res, carne de pollo, queso, huevo, pan, gaseosas, helados, salchichón, mantequilla, etc. Reyna  es una mujer de 45 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio, María mujer de 44 años su negocio es una comideria, María Margarita mujer de 49 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos y Nieves mujer de 48 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five entrepreneurs. One of the members is Humbelina, a fifty-three year old woman who is single and has a thirty-one year old son.  

For the past seven years her business has been running a grocery store from her home. She has been a member of this institution for two years now. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase beef, chicken, cheese, eggs, bread, soft drinks, ice cream, salami, butter, etc.  

Reyna is forty-five years old. Her business is a grocery store located in her home. 
María, forty-four years old, has a restaurant.  
Maria Margarita is forty-nine years old. Her business is selling clothes and shoes. 
Forty-eight year old Nieves has a business selling Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, cheese, eggs, bread, soft drinks, ice cream, salami, butter, etc.

loans.name: Luz Eterna Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Fátima mujer de 40 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos de 22 y 9 años. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, cosmético de Avon y Zermat desde hace 8 años, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad, tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución financiera, el crédito lo solicita para comprar  ropa, camisetas, camisas, pantalones, chores, toallas de baño, talladores, licras y cosméticos crema facial, crema para el cuerpo, crema de manos, perfume de dama y varón, etc. Adriana mujer de 29 años su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Alejandra de 32 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, refrescos, helados.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members, one of whom is 40-year-old Fátima.  She has two children; one is 22 years old, and the other is 9.  Fátima has had a business selling new clothes, and Avon and Zermat products for eight years.  She sells her products in her community and has been with the communal bank for four years.  Fátima is applying for a loan to buy clothes, such as shirts, t-shirts, trousers, shorts, bath towels, Lycra clothing, and cosmetics, such as facial cream, body creams, hand creams, men's and women's perfumes, and more.  Adriana is 29 years old and has a grocery store that she runs out of her home.  Thirty-two-year-old Alelandra has a business selling clothes, shoes, fizzy drinks, and ice creams.

loans.use: to buy clothes, such as shirts, t-shirts, trousers, shorts, bath towels, Lycra clothing, and cosmetics, such as facial cream, body creams, hand creams, men's and women's perfumes, and more.

loans.name: Las Madres Group

texts.es: El grupo  está formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es  Darling mujer de 33 años de edad, acompañada con cuatro hijos de 13, 12, 11 y 3 años. Su negocio es la venta de anteojos y accesorios para celulares desde hace 7 años, su esposo y ella atienden su negocio, es cliente de la institución desde hace 6 años. El crédito lo solicita para comprar lentes de lujos, carcasa, protectores, manos libres, cargadores de casa, de vehículo, parabrisas, etc. Jaritza mujer de 20 años de edad su negocio es la venta de gafas y celulares y  Glenda mujer de 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de lentes de sol, lanillas para limpiar carros.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three micro-businesswomen.  One of them is Darling.  She is a 33-year-old woman, and lives with her four children (ages 13, 12, 11, and 3).  Her business is selling sunglasses and cellphone accessories.  She has been doing this for seven years.  Her husband helps her attend to the store.  She has been a member of the communal bank for six years.

The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of luxury sunglasses, cases, protective coverings, hands-free sets, home and car chargers, phone holders that attach to the windshield, etc.  

Jaritza is a 20-year-old woman and her business is selling glasses and phones, and Glenda is a 34-year-old woman whose business is selling sunglasses and special cloths for cleaning cars.

loans.use: to buy cases, protective coverings, hands-free sets, home and car chargers, phone holders that attach to the windshield, luxury sunglasses, etc.

loans.name: El Triunfante Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es María mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 20, 19 y 16 años. Su negocio es destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales desde hace 20 años, sus dos hijos varones y su hija mayor le ayudan en la proceso de destace y elaboración del producto. El crédito lo solicita para comprar cerdo en pie. Reyna mujer de 32 años de edad su negocio es la compra y venta de productos naturales y Cristhian mujer de 23 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful members. One of them is María, who is 52. married and has three children aged 20, 19 and 16. Her business has been butchering pigs and selling nacatamales for 20 years. Her two sons and her oldest daughter help her in the butchering process of the pigs and in making her products. She is asking for the loan to buy a live pig. Reyna is a 32 year old woman. Her business is buying and selling natural products and Cristhian is a 23 year old woman and her business is selling used clothing.

loans.use: to invest in buying a live pig.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Jelua mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos menores de 8, 2 años y 1 mes de nacida, su negocio es estilista a domicilio desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año y cuatro meses, el crédito lo solicita para comprar queratina, tinte, shampoo especializados para el cuidado del cabello y un horno facial para hacer uñas acrílicas. Anielcka mujer de   24 años de edad su negocio es la venta de bisutería y Arlen mujer de 33 años de edad  se dedica a la docencia de informática.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is 24-year-old Jelua.  She is married and has three children, aged eight years, two years, and one month old each.  Jelua has been a home stylist for five years, and has been a member of the communal bank for one year and four months.  She is applying for a loan to buy inventory for her business - keratin, dye, special shampoo, and an oven for making acrylic nails.  Anielcka is 24 years old and has a business selling costume jewellery.  Thrirty-three-year-old Arlen makes a living teaching computer skills.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business - keratin, dye, special shampoo, and an oven for making acrylic nails.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
This is Ronald, 28, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. His partner is Nelma and they have one child. Together with his partner, he manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ronald operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. He also sells rice, charcoal, and bananas. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Ronald dreams to have a new stall in the market and hopes to have a vehicle. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is from the city of Dipolog. She is 30 years old. Romelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Romelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2008, Romelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 8,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Romelyn is requesting a new loan of PHP 50,000, which will be used to purchase additional goods for her new business, a mini grocery. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Romelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her new business mini grocery store.

location.town: Dipolog-Sta.Isabel, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, 28, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Jerwin, a worker abroad and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genalyn hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams to always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Herminia dreams that her family will always be in good health and hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is a 22-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one daughter. 

Her husband has recently established a gas station in which he sells liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to rickshaw drivers. Previously, he has not had any proper work to earn income for his family. In his area lot of people drive auto rickshaws and there is lot of demand for fuel, so he decided to open a gas station so that he could earn maximum profit. This strategy became the cause of establishment of gas station in no time. He started this business with very low capital and does not have sufficient amount to buy more LPG cylinders to fulfill the demand. Due to the rapid increase in the demand for LPG, Humaira's husband wants to buy more gas cylinders so that he can easily fulfill this demand.

Humaira wants her husband to establish his business well, so that she can make some savings to ensure the secure future of her children. Humaira is very pleased about this cooperation and very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy LPG gas cylinder for gas station.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 47-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. 

Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his younger son by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Rehana wants to grow the business of her husband so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, in her third loan cycle, with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, detergent and soap for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en:
This is the Sari Rahayu group's second loan from MUK, with is of the same loan size as the first. With the ten members, the total loan is 20 million IDR. 
The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages.

Ni Made, as the head of the group, is using a loan to buy a sow, because the price for piglet is expensive. Price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500.000 IDR. She has a plan to be a piglet seller. 

Ni Made expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy a sow

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon, 34-years-old, is married to a government employee. They blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store business for almost 10 years, with this business she's earning a net income of PHP 1,000 a day. Due to insufficient capital, she decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase coffee, noodles, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, noodles, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, and beverages to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
This is Telma's eighth loan cycle. As she used the loans that she borrowed in her business, she can see that it is continuously growing and expanding. As of now, she is also a mineral water distributor. Her income from her loan assisted her children's education and her family's everyday expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Telma hopes the business will flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella's eighth loan cycle. Aside from her fruits and vegetables, she also sells fish nets and drums. She also has a variety store. In the ups and downs of all her businesses, she remains standing and firm in her faith in God. Her husband is very supportive of her as he helps her run the business. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bella dreams to have more customers and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 35 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost 3 years. In this business she is earning a net income of Php 4,500 when she sell 1 hog. 

She decided to avail a loan from generous lenders due to lack of capital. She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 17,000, to purchase hogs and hog feeds. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it immediately in her hog raising business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feeds

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is from the beautiful city of Pakistan. She is 34 years old, and has a partner and two school-aged children, one of whom goes to primary school, and the other is in secondary school. Saima is a friendly, hard working and honorable person, which she has shown through her three previous loans with BRAC. These have a major impact on her family because they have helped her to improve her home. Her husband owns a construction material shop in which he sells cement, brick, sand, concrete and provides sheltering services also. She will use this new loan to buy building materials, such as bricks, sand and cement to sell. She would like to thank Kiva for this support since it is enabling her to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy construction material such as cement, sand, concrete and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 54-year old married woman living with her spouse and 5 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband has grown old and sits idle at home. Her elder son owns a butcher shop and he earns sufficient income for the whole family. Recently he spends a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which decreases his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. He tried to take out loans from banks and other organizations however he does not have any property against security. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan which will provide the facility without asking about their assets.  Rehana wants to provide higher education foir her children. It is her dream to provide all facilities of life for her children.  She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chicken  for resale.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Amadou âgé 55 ans marié d'une femme et père de 5 enfants habite dans le sud du Sénégal .3 enfants sont à l'école ,son fils ainé âge de 25 ans a quitté l'école pour soutenir son père dans son commerce .Amadou capitalise une expérience de 20 ans .Amadou fait ses achats de la marchandise à Dakar la capitale pour venir renforcer son stock et revendre pour avoir plus de bénéfice.Il sollicite pour la première fois un crédit de 700 000f pour renforcer son stock .Avec son commerce il assure toutes les charges de la famille et les frais scolaires.Amadou souhaite ouvrir une 2èm boutique dans l'avenir pour son fils
texts.en: Amadou is 55 years old, married to a woman and father to 5 children. He lives in the south of Senegal. 3 children are in school, his oldest son who is 25 left school to support his father in his business. Amadou capitalizes on 20 years experience. Amadou buys his merchandise in Dakar, the capital, to strengthen his stock and resell to have more profits. For the first time he is requesting a loan of 700,000f to strengthen his stock. With his business he ensures all the responsibilities of his family and the school fees. Amadou hopes to open a second store in the future for his son.

loans.use: to strengthen his stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: La señora Judith es una persona sencilla, proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, la señora Judith tiene 21 años, es una persona joven emprendedora; desde que tenía 18 años comenzó con la elaboración de chocolates, primero empezó elaborando para su familia de forma artesanal, por consejo de sus padres y hermanos quien al degustar los chocolates elaborados por la señora Judith, sus familiares le sugirieron y apoyaron para  que abra un pequeño negocio, este negocio con el transcurso de los años se consolidado en el mercado, logrando expandirse cada año  por el buen servicio y producto elaborado por la señora Judith,  la señora Judith elabora sus chocolates en el domicilio de sus padres. Esta expansión género que exista más clientes que requieren sus chocolates. La señora Judith viendo esta necesidad solicita un crédito para la compra de una conservadora para que le facilite el proceso de elaboración y comercialización de los chocolates.
texts.en:
Judith is a very humble person and comes from a modest and hard-working family. Judith is 21 years old and she is an entrepreneurial young woman.  When she was 18 she began making handmade craft chocolates for her family. Based on the advice, encouragement, and support of her parents and siblings, she later opened a small business.  The business has expanded each year due to great customer service and a great handmade product, and it has now moved to the marketplace. 

Judith makes the chocolates in her parent's house and with the business's expansion there are now more and more customers that request her chocolates.  Judith is seeking a loan so that she can buy a refrigerator to help her better craft and sell her chocolates.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial. Día a día se esfuerza mucho para poder Salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre y todos sus esfuerzos son para poder brindarle a su hijo una vida digna. Dora trabaja como obrera agrícola, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día en el campo, ya que realiza labores e siembra y cosecha de cultivo.

Dora está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar golosinas, bebidas, gaseosas, entre otros, para poder iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de dulces, con lo cual le permitirá tener un ingreso extra para su hogar y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una profesión”.
texts.en:
Dora is a very hardworking 30-year-old woman who lives in the city of Imperial. The mother of a small boy, Dora strives each day for a better life and to provide a decent life for her son. Dora does farm labor, working about eight hours a day in the fields on plantings and harvesting crops. 

Dora is extremely grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to their help she'll be able to purchase snacks, drinks, sodas, and other goods to start a small business selling candy. The business will provide additional income to meet Dora's household expenses and improve her quality of life. Dora will then be able to continue striving toward the realization of her greatest ambition: to ensure that her son has an education and a career.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, drinks, and sodas.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy vive en la población de Entre Ríos, junto a su esposa y su hija. Trabaja vendiendo ropa en el mercado, realiza la venta de ropas y zapatos de damas junto a su esposa, esta actividad económica es la mayor fuente de ingreso de don Freddy, es un negocio familiar, la mercadería la compra del departamento de Santa Cruz. Adicionalmente el señor Freddy también se dedica al área agrícola como actividad secundaria lo cual ha ido emprendiendo, trabaja en el terreno agrícola de su padre produciendo yuca. El señor Freddy decidió comprarse un terreno, solicita el crédito para completar el pago del terreno que desea comprar ya que sus ahorros no son suficientes para pagar dicho terreno, de esta manera los ingresos del señor Freddy mejoraran.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in the town of Entre Ríos with his wife and daughter. He and his wife have a shop in a market where they sell women's clothing and footwear. The couple buys their inventory wholesale in the Santa Cruz region. 

Although the clothing and footwear business is the family's main source of income, Freddy has also started a second job working on his father's farm growing yucca. Freddy has decided to purchase a plot of land and is applying for a loan. His savings aren't sufficient to cover the purchase price, and a loan will allow him to begin cultivating this plot and boost his income.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 38 años, está casada con Roy y tiene 04 hijos, de 15, 08, 04, y 02 años, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Zoila se dedica a la venta de cosméticos tales como maquillajes, perfumes, cremas para manos, entre otros, en su cuadra tiene muchos clientes quienes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, hace sus pedidos al por mayor por medio de catálogos. Espera a que sus clientes vayan a su casa y cuando no hay ventas sale a buscarlos, pues durante los 02 años que se dedica a este trabajo aprendió que hay que ir a buscar a los clientes para poder venderles algún producto, trabaja sola ya que eso le permite tener mejores ganancias. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará más cosméticos como perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Zoila is 38 years old and she is married to Roy.  They have 4 children that are 15, 8, 4, and 2 years old. They all live in their own home.  Zoila sells cosmetics such as make-up, perfume, hand cream, and other items like these.  She has a lot of loyal customers, especially her neighbors, friends, and relatives.  

She sells mostly by catalog and oftentimes her customers come to her home to place orders.  When nobody arrives to place an order, she goes door-to-door selling her products.  Over the past 2 years, she has learned that she has to go out in search of customers in order to sell more products.  She works alone because it enables her to make a higher income.  

This is her second loan from Kiva and it will enable her to continue doing her work.  She promises to comply with the repayment schedule.  With this loan of 600 soles, she will buy more cosmetics such as perfume, powder, deodorant, and others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfume, powder, deodorant, and others.

loans.name: Teyfa

texts.en:
Teyfa is a 36-year-old woman. She is an internally displace person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement with her kids.   Teyfa has raised cattle and cows for 10 years. She loves her business.
Teyfa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Teyfa also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1800 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, two milk cows and fodder. This will be her 4th loan and Teyfa has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle, two milk cows and fodder.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes du même village unies par de bons liens de voisinage.

Madame Amy est une femme mariée âgée de 54 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et deux filles et de trois petites filles toutes scolarisées.

Elle est le responsable du dit groupe fondé depuis le cycle premier du banc et constitué par de femmes du village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de céréales par la vente de mil et de niébé.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs cfa elle va acheter des 40 sacs de mil à 400000 et le reste des sacs de niébé à 100000.

Les bénéfices réalisés l'aide dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires de la famille et des frais scolaires de ses petits enfants.
texts.en: This group is made up of women from the same village, who are united by good neighborly ties.
