Ms. Amy is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of 5 children, three of whom are boys and two of whom are girls. She also has three granddaughters, who are all in school. She is the leader of said group, which was founded during the banc's first loan cycle and is made up of women from the village, united by good social and professional relations. She started in the grain business through the sale of millet and black-eyed peas. With her new loan of 500000 francs CFA, she is going to buy 40 bags of millet at 400000, and with the rest, bags of black-eyed peas at 100000. The profits she makes help her to take care of her family's dietary needs and her grandchildren's school fees.

loans.use: to buy millet and black-eyed peas for a small business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 41 years old, married and blessed with five children aged 24, 19, 15, 13 and 9 years. She has a dairy farm and sells milk. This is a business she has been doing for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.  

Margaret has requested a loan of KES 100,000 to purchase animal feed and animal medication. The profit she earns will aid her educate her children. She hopes to excel in life.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medication for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock feeds

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is 50 years old, married and a father of 4 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Baxtiyar has been breeding cattle and cows for the last 20 years.
He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Baxtiyar also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

He wants to expand his business and improve life conditions of his family. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milking cow and fodder. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín vive en la comunidad de Entre Ríos, junto a sus tres hijos y su esposa, se dedica a la agricultura, trabajan en su terreno agrícola propio, que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo durante la colonización, migrando de los lugares donde hay poco movimiento económico; actualmente  produce cítricos, yuca y arroz anualmente; los productos  los venden a los intermediarios que vienen a comprar al lugar de cosecha; la producción es familiar y a la vez contrata personal eventual que le colabora en el mantenimiento y en la cosecha de los productos. Actualmente cuentan con 1 hectárea de cítricos lo cual ya fue cosechado y vendido por lo cual solicitan el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento (desmalezado) de la parcela y posteriormente su fertilización, para que el siguiente año la producción rinda óptimamente. Con este crédito el señor Joaquín podrá realizar lo propuesto con su parcela de cítricos.
texts.en:
Joaquín lives in the Entre Ríos community with his three siblings and his wife, making his living in farming. They work in their own plot of agricultural land which Joaquín acquired with a lot of hard work during the agricultural colonization, migrating from the areas where there was little economic movement.

He currently produces citrus fruits, yucca and rice on an annual basis, and they sell these products to intermediaries who come to buy directly at the place of harvest. The family work together to produce the crops, although they hire help if necessary to help tend and harvest the crops.

They currently have 1 hectare of citrus fruits which has already been harvested and sold, which is why they are seeking the loan to tend to the plot of land (weeding), and subsequently fertilize it so that production next year is at its optimal rate. With this loan, Joaquín will be able to carry out the above work on his citrus crops.

loans.use: to weed his plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Evez

texts.en:
Evez is 48 years old and an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and children. He is a farmer who has farmed seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 15 years. During this time, Evez has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop because it is profitable and fresh fruit and vegetables are in high demand. 

In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables daily and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table and are also used to make fresh punch. 
Evez usually sells his goods in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. As his products are in high demand, he wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. He has therefore applied for a loan of 1900 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. Evez has a good credit history and this will be his 3rd loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 29 años de edad, está casada con Enrique quien es independiente y padre de su  hijo de 04 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Lucia se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas para eso tiene en su casa una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperatura helada y al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluroso de la zona, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 07 años con este negocio. Se decido empezar con está actividad por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, considerando que así lograrán progresar más rápidamente. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y está agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más bebidas de distintas marcas y sabores, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucia, 29, is married to Enrique, who's independent and the father of her child, 4.  They live together in their own house.

Lucia works selling carbonated beverages of various flavors and brands.  She has a refrigerator in her house where she keeps her products cold, just as her customers like because it's a hot area.  She serves her customers very pleasantly.

She started this business more than seven years ago because she needed to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses.  This way they'll get ahead more quickly.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead and promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy more beverages in a variety of brands and flavors.  She'll look for good prices for her purchases so she'll earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 27 años de edad una mujer joven, emprendedora, con muchos deseos de superarse en la vida, casada, ama de casa y caficultora madre de 2 hijos y en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabajan diariamente para salir adelante. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo gracias al apoyo financiero brindado por sus padres. Ella se dedica a la caficultura hace 5 años la cual aprendió junto a su compañero de hogar y los terrenos que juntos cultivan son herencia de sus padres.

Ella ha solicitado un apoyo financiero a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, urea, formula cafetalera, que ayuden a mantener sus cultivos de café protegidos de la roya y de la broca entre otros bichos y enfermedades que deterioran la cosecha.  

Sus planes en un futuro es poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café con la cual pueda ofrecer y competir en el mercado para poder salir adelante y algún día poder sacarlo del país como un producto de calidad. Su sueño para su negocio y su familia es obtener una mayor producción como lo dijo anteriormente y poder completar la educación de sus hijos hasta llegar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Blanca is 27 years old, she is a young enterprising woman with a keen desire to excel in life. She is married, a housewife, a coffee grower and mother to two children. It is in the company of her partner that they work every day to get ahead in life. Blanca has a full primary education thanks to her parent's financial support. She has been making her living in coffee for five years, a trade she learnt together with her partner, and the plots that they cultivate together are inherited from her parents.

She has sought financial support from the COMIXMUL communal bank to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, urea and coffee crop formula which help to protect her crops from rust and the coffee borer beetle among other pests and illnesses which damage the crop.

Blanca's plans for the future are to cultivate a better variety of coffee to offer and compete in the market to get ahead in life, and to one day export her product as a high-quality product. Blanca's dream for the business and her family is to obtain a larger harvest as already mentioned, and to complete her children's education up to university level.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La señora Alejandrina de 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la comunidad de Canco, estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores que estudian en nivel primaria, la actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Alejandrina es la agricultura, la señora Alejandrina produce  papa, papaliza, oca, haba; de esta producción percibe ingresos económicos; cultiva en 2 hectáreas de terreno con rotación de cultivos,  los terrenos son herencia de sus padres. Alejandrina solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico, semilla de papa, Alejandrina comenta que con el préstamo tendrá mejores ingresos que  garantizaran la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y lograra tener ahorros para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 33 years old and lives with her parents in Canco. She is unmarried and has 2 children who are in primary school. 

Alejandrina earns a living farming. She cultivates potatoes, ulluco, oca and beans. From this production she earns an income. She cultivates 2 hectares of land with crop rotation. The land is an inheritance from her parents. 

Alejandrina is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies, organic manure and potato seeds. 

Alejandrina says that with this loan she will increase her income, providing food security for her family. It will also enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sevindik

texts.en:
Sevindik is 46-year-old married man with three children.  He lives with his family in an internally displaced persons (IDP) settlement, as he is an IDP. 

Sevindik raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. He has 15 years of experience, and he has gained respect from local vendors because he produces a good organic crop without chemical fertilizers.

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthful. Many national dishes like pilau and dolma are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also are used to make fresh punch.

Sevindik sells his crop from his yard and sometimes takes it to the local bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN and he would like to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops to increase his sales. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. This will be his fifth loan, and he has a positive client history

loans.use: to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21-year-old single Egyptian citizen, living and working in a Palestinian camp in Lebanon.

He has worked in tailoring curtains since six years ago. His work is located inside the camp, but he has customers from the neighboring villages because of his skillful reputation. Today Ibrahim has two employees who help him in his work. He hopes to expand his work more in the future to accept more requests and recruit more people.

Ibrahim is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for his business development. This car will surely facilitate his tools and production transportation from his shop to the customers. He will also buy the necessary clothes and accessories from the market.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for his business development.

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en:
Naiba is 48-year-old woman with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. 

When she was 13, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support her family.
Naiba’s income from her business is 150 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that in the near future her children will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

Naiba needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her third loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Velma

texts.en:
Velma is a 33-year-old lady from the Kakamega region in western part of Kenya. She is married to Mudiri, who is a businessman within the same region and supports the family. Together they have two children who are 13 and 4 years old.

Velma operates an M-PESA (money services) where she does money-exchange transactions. She has been doing this for the last five years and is comfortable to generate a monthly income of KES 80,000.

She has applied for her first loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to increase her working capital so that she can do more transactions. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Her dream is to expand the business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to increase the working capital so that she can do more money transfers.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
This is the sixth loan for the Wiguna Merta  group. The members will need financial support for their businesses until they are able to continue them with their own capital. With every sale of pork, they save a portion to use for venture capital. 

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase a sow. She plans to sell piglets for pig roll. Pig for pig, "bolsters" require less care than superior quality pigs and they sell faster. Ni Ketut hopes her new plan will be more successful. 

Note: One member couldn’t attend the meeting because she was sick.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is a 43-year-old married man and a father of three children from Trinidad, Bohol. 

Dioscoro has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now. This is the source of his income.

Dioscoro is asking for a loan to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his hog-raising business by growing healthy pigs.

In the future, Dioscoro hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya, whose hand is raised in the picture, is 29 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, whose needs are growing as they get older. 

Her husband provides transportation services in his auto rickshaw. He has been doing this work for about six years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now he feels tranquil and comfortable because he has a regular income and more free time. 

This will be Ruqaiya’s first loan with Kiva. She will use it to buy spare parts, such as tires, tubes, bolts and a headlight for the maintenance of her husband’s auto rickshaw.

She hopes that, with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old lady from the Migori region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports seven people in her family and is married to Aloice, who is a farmer and supports the family by providing extra income to the family. She has three children who are 14, 12 and 10 years old.

Beatrice has a retail shop that she has been operating for the last five years, and she generates a monthly income of KES 6,000. She has applied for her sixth loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more shop items like sugar, salt, bar soap and cooking oil for resale. She plans to use anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Beatrice's dream is educate all her children and expand the current business.

loans.use: to purchase more shop items.

loans.name: Efipania

texts.en:
Efipania is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven grown up children. 

Efipania has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is their main source of income.

Efipania is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Efipania hopes to expand their farming business and make it a success and stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en:
Patriciah is a 37-year-old married woman. She describes herself as focused. She operates a green grocery, where she sells onions, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial. 

This is Patriciah’s first loan with the Small and Micro Enterprise Programme. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. Her business goal is to be a retailer within five years.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 28 years old. He is married and he has two children. He is an internally displaced person who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement with his wife and  children. 

He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years. During these years Nusrat gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthful. Many national dishes like pilau and dolma are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and also are used in fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Nusrat wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,600 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
This is Nelsa, 50, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a beauty consultant, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nelsa dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmen Daria

texts.es: La  Sra. Carmen Daria, tiene 32 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños que se encuentran estudiando en el nivel primario del colegio fiscal debido a que no cuentan con suficientes recursos para que haga estudiar a sus hijos en colegios particulares, el colegio esta ubicado en la zona donde vive, en esta zona se encuentran la mayor cantidad de ganado para la producción de leche cruda, es por  esto que la Sra. Carmen Daria también se dedica a esta actividad durante mas de 11 años, la leche es entregada por las mañanas y tardes a una empresa. El credito solicitado es para la compra de alimento para sus vacas, ya que la Sra. Carmen Daria en este mes es donde compra forraje para todo el año y por lo cual incurre en varios gastos.
texts.en:
Carmen Daria is 32 years old, she is married and has two young children who are undertaking primary level studies at a state school as she doesn't have enough money to send her children to study in a private school. The school is located in the area in which she lives; it is here that there is the largest quantity of cattle producing raw milk, this is why Carmen Daria has also been making her living in this activity for more than 11 years.

The milk is given to a company in the morning and in the afternoon. The credit she is seeking is to buy feed for her cows as Carmen Daria finds herself in the month in which she buys fodder for the whole year and as such she incurs various costs.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalia, es una persona de 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, actualmente junto a su familia viven y desarrollan su actividad económica en su comunidad de origen y cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo las cuales son sus hijas. La actividad económica de la señora Rosalia y su esposo es la producción agrícola, los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa, haba, maíz y trigo en sus propios terrenos que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Conda Arriba. La señora Rosalía manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere incrementar el numero de sus ganados bovinos los cuales apartir del desarrollo y su producción le permitiran generar ingresos adicionales, lo cual le pemitira mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 34-year-old woman who is married and managed to complete primary school studies. At the moment, she lives and develops her financial activity in her native community and has two economic dependents which are her children. Rosalia and her husband's economic activity is agricultural production, the main items they produce are potatoes, beans, corn and wheat in their own land which are found in the Conda Arriba community.

Rosalia states that she is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to increase the number of cows which by developing their production will enable them to generate additional income which will enable her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El señor Martin tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la poblacion de villa tunari, es soltero. Martin tiene un lote agricola donde tiene la plantacion de 4 hectareas de citricos y como actividad secundaria trabaja como  albañil (contramaestro). Martin vivia en el departamento de La Paz hace como 16 años atrás, sin embargo el tuvo que venirse a Villa tunari ya que no tuvo ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, el señor Martin se volvió a levantar  junto a su familia ya que tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino y empezo de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Martin es para la construccion de su vivienda, ya que de esa manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera, sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Martín, 36, is single and lives in the town of Villa Tunari.  He has land with a 4-hectare citrus farm.  As a secondary activity he works as a bricklayer (foreman).

Martín used to live in the department of La Paz around 16 years ago.  He had to go to Villa Tunari because he didn't earn enough income to be able to support his family.  Martín got back on his feet with his family and moved in a new direction and started all over again.

The loan Martín's requesting is to build his house.

This way he'll be able to have a better quality of life and help his children finish their degrees.  He dreams of a better future for his children because he wasn't able to finish a degree.

loans.use: to build his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of meats to sell.

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en: Vilayat is 30 years old, married and has a one son. Vilayat is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his wife and son in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Vilayat has bred cattle for last 5 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his own business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle. Vilayat usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profit at the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also keeps milk cows for personal use and for sale to neighbors. He has already taken 2 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a third loan of 1800 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milk cow. With this money, he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and one milk cow

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a 47-year-old man, married with 3 daughters. Akbar is an IDP (internally displaced person). He breeds cows and cattle, sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Akbar has 10 years of experience in this field, and the reason which pushed him to start his own business was a very low pension. Akbar usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings an income of 400 AZN per month. 
Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life. This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved daughters. Akbar applied for a 1800 AZN to purchase three cattle, two milking cows, and fodder. This will be his third loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle, two milking cows and fodder.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 38 years old and married to a welder for almost 15 years. They don't yet have any children. Mary Jane has been into direct selling business for almost 15 years and she is earning a net income of Php 1,500 a month. Due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 15,000 to purchase talc powder, lipstick, eye shadow, body spray and lotions to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can develop her business and produce more personal use products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase talc powder, lipstick, eyeshadow, body spray and lotions to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. Elisa is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this loan, Elisa will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Elisa wants to expand her farm and makes it a stable source of her income. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 59 años de edad, está casada con Ladislao quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja, su hija, su yerno y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Elva es propietaria de un salon de juegos por esa razón cuenta con mesas billar en su hogar, en donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que vienen a su local desde diversos lugares. Alquila las mesas de juego únicamente a personas adultas ya que es consciente del efecto negativo que esta actividad puede acarrear principalmente sobre los niños. Se inició en esta labor hace más de 2 años, pues ya tenía mesas de billar que fueron traídos de otra localidad donde vivía anteriormente y con ayuda de sus hijos lo instalaron en su domicilio actual. Gracias a su esfuerzo está logrando que su negocio pueda surgir, por fortuna tiene el apoyo incondicional de su cónyuge y eso la anima a seguir adelante. Complementa su labor con la venta de golosinas y bebidas. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que le brindan las personas para acceder a este financiamiento el cual le ayudará a mejorar su trabajo, además se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en el arreglo de su local comprando pintura, madera y clavos, así mismo renovará algunos implementos de juego como bolas y palos de billar.
texts.en: Elva, 59 years old, is married to Ladislao, who is a merchant and the father of her children. She and her husband live with their daughter, son-in-law, and two grandchildren in a home they own. Elva runs a game room with pool tables in her home, where she welcomes customers who come to her place from all over. She only rents the tables to adults because she is aware of the potential negative effects of this activity, especially on children. She started the business more than two years ago because she already had pool tables that she had brought from another place where she'd lived before and installed in her current home with her children's help. Thanks to her efforts, her business is doing very well. Luckily, she has her husband's unconditional support, which helps her keep going. She supplements her income by selling snacks and soft drinks. She is requesting 3000 soles. She is grateful for the opportunity and for the help people are giving her to obtain this financing, which will help her improve her business. She is committed to making all her payments on time. She will use the requested amount to refurbish her space, buying paint, wood, and nails, as well as to replace some items such as pool balls and cue sticks.

loans.use: to refurbish her space, buying paint, wood, and nails, as well as to replace some items such as pool balls and cue sticks.

loans.name: Symon

texts.en: Symon is a married man aged 33 years and he has 2 children aged 5 and 2 years. He sells clothes in Eldama Ravine location and has been in operation for a period of 6 years, earning an income of KES15,000. He is now servicing his 3rd loan of KES100,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase more new clothes for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to add livestock for his farm. His dream is to excel in his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes for resale

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. She has worked in selling clothes since 11 years ago. Roula is a hard worker; she puts so much effort into helping her husband in making their living and increasing their income to make sure that they are capable of covering their children's needs.

Roula is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly released collection. Her shop is located at the main road, which is an excellent spot to attract new customers each day, whom she makes sure to turn into loyal customers through her special customer service.

Roula intends to keep on expanding and increasing her business place and capital.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a newly released collection.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 50, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for her family’s everyday needs.

Rebecca maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Rebecca dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven children.

Elizabeth has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. Elizabeth works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially in educating their children.
 
Elizabeth needs a loan for her farming business. With this purpose, she joined CEVI, a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to avail the loan services offered by the organization to the micro-entrepreneurs like her. 

She is asking for a loan worth 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Elizabeth has plans of making her farming venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en: Launiu is a 39-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small business, selling pigs in her community. Launiu is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's education. She will also use part of the loan to buy barbed wire, cement and a chainsaw. Launiu joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, cement and a chainsaw and pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es originaria de la linda ciudad de Estelí conocida como el diamante de las Segovia, su estado civil es casada y tiene una hija mayor de edad y profesional. Doña Rosa  se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con deseo de superación.
Actualmente se desempeña como secretaria desde hace muchos años demostrando buen desarrollo profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, piso cerámica y lavamanos todo esto para construir servicio sanitario en su vivienda.

Rosa manifiesta que se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado por kiva y le parece muy bien este tipo de servicio ya que contribuye a reducir la contaminación ambiental y mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the beautiful city of Estelí, which is known as the diamond of the Segovia.  She is married, and she has an adult daughter who is a professional.  Rosa is known for being a hard-working and responsible woman with the desire to succeed.  She has been working as a secretary for many years, and she has shown good professional growth.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, tile flooring, and a sink.  All of this is in order to build a bathroom in her house.

Rosa is grateful for the help provided by Kiva.  This type of service seems very good to her because it contributes to reducing the environmental contamination, and it improves the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen lives in Gavar city in Gegharkunik region. He is 39 years old. He is married and has two small children. Gurgen’s wife does not work; she takes care of their children. Since Gurgen came back from the army, he has become engaged in a clothes-trading business. It is a small rented shop where he sells both women's and men's clothes, underwear, slippers and shoes; he also has a small collection of children clothes. His shop is just in the central part of the city and very often visited by the people from the whole of Gavar.
 
Gurgen asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge his trading business. He plans to buy a new autumn/winter clothes collection.

loans.use: to buy a new autumn/winter clothes collection and thus, enlarge his business.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four children. Enrique has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income.

Enrique is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm. Enrique is hopeful that he will be able to improve his business in the future so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, such as food and paying the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
Cupertino es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Sus estudios sólo llegan hasta nivel de secundaria. Cupertino esta afiliado al sindicato TRANS BOLIVIA  tiene un microbus en el cual hace la ruta CARANAVI – GUANAY .
Necesita crédito para  la refaccion de su cocina y  garaje (compra de material de construccion) 
El sueño de Cupertino es dar comodida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cupertino is married and has three children.  He lives in his own home, located in the city of El Alto.  He has s junior high school education.  Cupertino is part of the TRANS BOLIVIA union and has a microbus where he drives the CARANAVI – GUANAY route.

He needs this loan to upgrade his kitchen and garage (buy building materials).  Cupertino’s dream is to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es de la ciudad de Ybycui, el vive con sus padres y comenta que gracias el esfuerzo que ellos hicieron por el está donde está.
Pedro está estudiando la carrera de Análisis de sistemas, y quiere poder ayudar a su familia con la profesión que esta estudiando, y de esa forma retribuirles todo lo que le ayudaron. Comenta también que le gustaría poder tener su propio negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y así poder cubrir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of Ybycui and lives with his parents.  He says that he is where he is now, thanks to the effort they put forth for him.

Pedro is studying for a career in systems analysis and he wants to be able to help his family through this profession and repay them for all the help they gave him.  He wants to be able to have his own business.

He is asking for this loan so he can pay his tuition and in this way pay for his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian viene de una familia muy trabajadora, que es muy dedicada y esforzada por salir adelante.
Cristian tiene como meta recibirse de abogado y ayudar a las personas que necesiten de el, quiere ser un profesional que sea útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a la sociedad.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, ya que de esa forma podrá estar un poco más tranquilo y así cubrir esos gastos.
texts.en:
Cristian is from a working family who works hard and is dedicated to getting ahead.  Cristian’s goal is to become a lawyer and help people in need.  He wants to be a useful professional, not only to himself, but also to society.

He is asking for this loan to be able to pay for his classes so that he can be a little more at ease and cover his expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada lleva una vida tranquila en su querida ciudad de Pilar, tiene muchos sueños y aspiraciones para el futuro; desea terminar sus estudios para convertirse en una profesional con título, ayudar a su familia mucho más y salir adelante cada día.
Ella esta luchando ya que quiere ser una buena profesional que sea útil, no solo a si misma sino también a los demás. Se destaca por ser una excelente estudiante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, y agradece por esta gran oportunidad que están recibiendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ada leads a relaxing life in her city of Pilar.  She has many dreams and aspirations for the future and wants to complete her studies and become a titled professional, help her family more, and get ahead every day.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her university expenses.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Apenas pudo terminar la primaria. Gregorio se gana la vida como minero, su esposa trabaja elaboracion de mantas. Necesita crédito para comprar puertas para su vivienda, pues las que tiene están demasiado viejas 
El sueño de Gregorio es brindar comodidad  a su familia
texts.en:
Gregorio is married, has three children, and lives in a home of his own in El Alto.

He has an elementary school education and works as a miner.  His wife makes blankets.  He needs a loan so he can buy doors for his house because the ones he has now are very old.

Gregorio’s dream is to provide comfort for his family.

loans.use: to buy new doors.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella pudo terminar la secundaria, ahora se dedica a la venta ambulante de diversos artículos de uso personal. Necesita crédito para incrementar su capital, poder ofrecer más productos a la venta y así ganar más dinero 
El sueño de Brigida  es convertirse en una gran comerciante
texts.en:
Brigida is married and has two children.  She lives with her parents in the city of El Alto.

She was able to complete junior high school and sells various personal use items on foot.  She needs this loan so she can increase her working capital, offer more products, and earn more money.

Brigida’s dream is to become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Calixto es casado, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
Calixto no pudo estudiar más allá de la primaria. Se gana la vida como albañil en diferentes obras, mientras que su esposa es ama de casa. Necesita crédito para una muralla que su vivienda necesita con urgencia (compra de material de construccion) 
El sueño de Calixto es tener una casa terminada y segura
texts.en:
Calixto is married and has a home of his own in El Alto.

Calixto was not able to study beyond elementary school.  He earns a living as a mason on different tasks, while his wife is a housewife.  He needs this loan so he can build a wall that he desperately needs onto his house (buy building materials).

Calixto’s dream is to have a completed and secure home.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es originario de linda ciudad de Matagalpa conocida como la perla del septentrión, su estado civil es casado tiene tres hijos en edad escolar y también convive con su mamá. Juan se identifica como un apersona de buenos valores morales.

Con el préstamo anterior expresa que ha sido de gran utilidad ya que pudo realizar algunas mejora en su vivienda.
Actualmente se desempeña como conducto de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace seis años.

solicita un crédito  para gastos medico: compra de medicamento pago de quimioterapia de su mamá  ya que se encuentra muy delicada de salud y los medicamentos son muy caro y tiene que trasladarla hasta la capital y es un problema urgente.

Juan agradece a ceprodel y kiva por el apoyo ya que de esta manera va ser posible realizar la compra del medicamento que necesita su mamá  para la recuperación de su salud.
texts.en:
Juan is from the pretty city of Matagalpa, known as the “Pearl of the North”. He is married with three school-aged children. He is known as a person with good morals. 
His last loan was very useful as he was able to make improvements to his home. For the past six years he has worked as an agent for pipe and sewage company.
He is asking for this loan in order to pay for medical expenses. He needs to buy medicine for his mother’s chemotherapy. Her health is fragile and the medicine is very expensive. He has to take her to the capital for treatment. This is an urgent problem.
Juan is thankful to Ceprodel and to KIVA for their support. They have made it possible for him to buy the necessary medicine for his mother, so that she can regain her health.

loans.use: to buy chemotherapy medicine for his mother.

loans.name: Eddy Orlando

texts.es: El señor Eddy, sueña cada dia por ver terminada su casa de habitacion que esta hubicada en el municipio de Ticuantepe, con este credito continuara con la construccion, el siempre trabaja para una financiera y su esposa es su soporte,le ayuda con la distribucion de los gastos del hogar ya que con su negocio a sabido apoyar a su esposo. con este segundo credito comprara Cemento, Arena y Zinc para darle fino a los costados de su casa para que pueda quedar mas bonita. Don Eddy espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Eddy dreams every day of finishing his home, which is located in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  With this loan, he will continue with the construction.  He has always worked for a financial institution, and his wife is his support.  She helps him with the household expenses, because she has known how to support her husband with her business.  With this second loan, Eddy will buy cement, sand and sheets of corrugated roofing material to put the finishing touches on his house so that it will be more beautiful.  Eddy hopes to continue to receive support from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para su tienda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar productos de  la canasta básica, tales como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar,  jabón, queso, entre otros.
El crédito anterior menciona la Sra. María que fue de mucha ayuda, ya que le permitió fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia. Ella, desea crecer en su actividad y apoyar a sus seres queridos siempre.
texts.en:
Maria needs a new loan because she needs more working capital for her store.  With this she will be able to buy basic products, such as rice, beans, cooking oil, soap, cheese, and other things.

Maria says that the previous loan was very helpful, allowing her to strengthen her business, and she was able to support her family with the profits.  She wants to always be able to support her loved ones.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Astra

texts.ru: Астре 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Астра имеет среднее образование. По характеру Астра: честная и пунктуальная. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2009 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Астры в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и 5 овец. Ее деятельность приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Астре построить дом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Астра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Доходы от кредита Астра планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Astra is 31 years old, married and has three children. Astra has secondary education. As a person she is honest and punctual. Her husband helps her with the business.

As a source of income for the family, Astra has been working with livestock breeding since 2009, after having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Astra's persistent work, she currently has one dairy cow, one calf and five sheep on the farm. Her business brings in around 6,000 som (KGS) per month. The income from the business allowed Astra to build a house. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Astra turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a bull-calf. Astra plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, and in the future she also intends to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf

loans.name: Kalerwe Ttula Tda- Farouk Group

texts.en:
Farouk is a 36-year-old taxi driver and a father of two. He does this work every day and has found it rewarding. He has been able to buy a plot of land and build a small house for his family in Kalerwe, a Kampala City suburb.

He started by driving other people's taxis, but now wants to buy his own taxi, and with his experience, he is sure it will be very rewarding. He therefore joined Kalerwe Tula Taxi Drivers Group so as to access a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from Ugafode Microfinance to top up and buy a taxi. He believes his profits will increase, and he will adequately meet his family's needs.

With hard work, he believes he will soon be able to have a stable income, put up some rentals and have his children’s education needs catered for. He thanks the lenders for their great contribution in uplifting them.

loans.use: to buy a taxi of his own.

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Nubia el Socorro R. habita en la comarca los Briones, uno de sus mayores deseos en esta vida es poderle dar a sus hijos lo mejor, su esposo le ayuda incondicionalmente ya que el labora para una empresa que ofrece el servico de Guarda de Seguridad, ella labora como docente para una empresa privada, con este credito ella compra materiales para continuar realizando las mejoras en su vivienda, actualmente le urge comprar materiales como Bloques, cemento, arena para levandar una pared en la parte trasera de su casa ya que la tiene cubierta con Zinc y ella quiera mayor seguridad. muy agradecida la selora Nubia con Afodenic y Fondos Kiva quien la han apoyado a lo  largo de estos años.
texts.en: Nubia el Socorro R. lives in the Los Briones district.  One of her main desires in life is to be able to give the best to her children.  Her husband helps her unconditionally, because he works for a company as a security guard.  She works as a teacher for a private company.  With this loan, she will buy materials to continue making improvements to her home.  At this time, she needs to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, cement, and sand to build a wall in the back of her house, because the wall she has now is made of corrugated metal, and she wants greater security.  Nubia is very grateful to Afodenic and Kiva, who have supported her all of these years.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane, est un sociétaire du guichet qui se trouve à la direction. Il loge à quelques minutes de marche en partant de la caisse. Il est maçon de profession depuis 1984 et possède une quincaillerie qu’il a ouverte il y a trois ans et qui est gérée par sa femme. Ousmane est marié et père de 6 enfants dont 2 d’un ancien mariage. Ses enfants vont les uns, au Lycée, les autres, au primaire et l’ainé suit des cours de couture. En dehors de ces charges, il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Ousmane sollicite un crédit de trois cent mille francs pour acheter des planches, du bois de coffrage qu’il va mettre en location. Grace au prêt, il peut désormais diversifier ses produits et services. Ousmane souhaite voir son capital augmenter afin de pouvoir acheter d’autres planches et les mettre toujours en location pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Ousmane is a member of a [UIMCEC] branch and lives just a few minutes from it. He has been a mason since 1984. He owns a hardware store, which he opened three years ago, and which is run by his wife.

Ousmane is married and a father of six children, of whom two are from a previous marriage. His children go to school. Some are in high school, the others are in primary school, and the eldest is in sewing classes.

Apart from school-related expenses, Ousmane also must provide for his family's everyday living expenses.

He is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy planks of wood that he will rent out. Thanks to this loan, he can diversify his products and services.

Ousmane wishes to see an increase in his capital so he can buy more planks [of wood], which he will also rent out to maximize his profits.

loans.use: to buy planks of wood to rent out

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald sigue con la misma actividad que es el del servicio de venta de vidrios tiene su vidriería donde le va muy bien utilizo el crédito  en la compra de vidrios por mayor cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material y herramientas  para su vidrieria, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad
texts.en: Ronald is continuing with the same activity: selling glass.  He has a glass workshop where he invested his previous loan very well by purchasing glass at wholesale.  He says that it went very well with his last loan.  At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and tools for his glass workshop.  He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that is being provided to him, because he is growing and improving his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for his glass workshop

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es: El Sr. Geronimo sigue con la misma actividad el es agricultor desde hace ya bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la siembra de papa, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la siembra de papa también comprara semillas y para el preparado de la tierra, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Geronimo continues to farm as he has done for some time. He says that everything went well with the last loan, which he used to sow potato seeds. Now, he is requesting a loan to sow more potato seeds, to buy seeds, and to prepare the land. He is happy and grateful for the opportunity he has been given, which is growing and improving his business.

loans.use: to sow potato seeds and prepare the land.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, está acompañado y disfruta de tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 8, 11 y 13 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y hasta la fecha no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su actividad y con las utilidades aportar a su familia.
El sueño del Sr. Mario es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y con la alimentación.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has three children, ages 8, 11, and 13.  He doesn’t have any family outside the country and he raises basic grains such as corn and beans.  He has been doing this for 20 years, learned this from his parents, and has not had any problems to date.

This loan will allow him to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, fungicides, and other things.  This will help him strengthen his business with which he supports his family.

Mario’s dream is to feed his children and support them with their schooling.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pago de mozos, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro reponerse de la pérdida del maíz, asimismo cultivo maicillo y por lo que logro acumular la cuota. La familia se ha mantenido y los ingresos han mejorado. Su deseo es ampliar la vivienda, agregar otro tipo de negocio; también sacar adelante a sus hijos y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Rosa needs a new loan because she needs more working capital.  This will allow her to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, pay for field hands, and other things.

The previous loan was a great help because it helped replenish her loss of corn and millet, the family was able to sustain itself, and the income has improved.  She wants to expand her home, start another type of business, and also get her children ahead and grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jacqueline Roxana

texts.es:
Jacqueline,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en su tienda para agrandar su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar aceite, cereales, huevos, boquitas, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros. 
La Sra. Jacqueline cuenta que fue favorable, ya que obtuvo ingresos y ganancias positivas; asimismo vende meriendas por las tardes. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y tiene una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaqueline needs a new loan to continue investing in her store and grow her business.  This loan will allow her to buy cooking oil, cereals, eggs, snacks, beans, sugar, and other things.

Jaqueline says that the previous loan was helpful and she made a profit.  She also sells food in the evenings.  Her financial situation has improved and she has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HIPERBANCO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Carmen Rosa tiene 56 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogos, la socia vende perfumes, colonias, entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes cómo amistades, familiares entre otros, a la vez la socia vende ropa a sus mismos clientes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como colonias para damas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia se siente agradecida con los inversionistas de kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the Hiperbanco community bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 56 years old, has four children, and is married.  She balances her daily activities with her business selling cosmetics from catalogs.  She sells perfume, cologne, and other items to customers who order them.  She sells to customers such as friends, relatives, and others.  She also sells clothing to the same customers.  Carmen Rosa is a responsible and enterprising person whose business is improving life for her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as women's cologne.  

The group members in the small attached photo asked permission to come late to the meeting because they were working.  The members are grateful for the Kiva lenders and promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, including women's cologne.

loans.name: Karla Waldina

texts.es:
Karla es una joven de 25 años de edad en un estado civil de unión libre casada madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven juntos en familia. Tiene un grado de educación de secundaria completa graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público pero no ejerce su profesión y su compañero de hogar trabaja en el registro nacional de las personas. Ella decidió emprender un mejor camino formando su propio negocio con el cultivo de café actividad que aprendió hace 5 años en compañía de su compañero de hogar siendo ellos los únicos que se involucran en cada una de las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo como: limpieza, abono, fertilización y en temporada la parte de recolección. En la actualidad su pareja y ella son apoyo mutuo para salir adelante del cual dependen sus 2 hijos.

Karla hoy en día está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, urea foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya.

Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo ya que el trabajo de la tierra es muy pesado y con tanta contaminación ambiental y la falta de materiales para el cuido, las ganancias que quedan son pocas, pero de esta forma ella podrá preparar y fortalecer su cultivo y tener una excelente cosecha y un buen patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla is a 25-year-old young woman. She is married, with two children who live with her family. She has completed secondary school, graduating in merchandising and accounting. She is not practicing her profession. Her household companion works in the national registry of citizens. Karla decided to start her own business growing coffee, a skill she learned five years ago from her partner’s company. She watched him work in all the different activities on the farm such as clearing the land, fertilizing, and harvesting. Actually she and her husband support each other in order to progress and help their dependent children. 
Karla is asking for this loan today in order to buy fertilizer, manure and chemicals among other items used to grow coffee. If the coffee plants are not maintained, they will suffer rust damage.
Her dream is to educate her children so that they have a better quality of life and better opportunities for employment. Working on the land is hard. There is a lot of exposure to pesticides. If you don’t have the supplies to maintain the crop, you earn very little. If she has this loan, she can prepare and maintain her crops. Then she will have a good harvest and be a good parent to her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer and other items for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирине 44 года, незамужем, имеет 1 совершеннолетнюю дочь в возрасте 21 года. Прожив в  гражданским браке 10 лет, Ирина осталась одна. В 2002 году, в поиске источника дохода  для своей маленькой семьи, Ирина начала продавать мужскую и женскую одежду на рынке поселка Каинда, использовав в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Так как торговля была не очень прибыльной, Ирина распродала весь товар и устроилась в магазин продавцом – реализатором, где проработала с 2006 по 2007 год. В качестве следующего этапа, Ирина решила сама взять в аренду близлежащий магазин с мыломоющими средствами  и косметикой. Благодаря упорству, настойчивости и ежедневному труду, Ирина смогла развить свой бизнес, доходы от которого помогли ей приобрести квартиру в своем поселке. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, а также Ирина намерена выкупить контейнер в котором торгует, Ирина обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Ирина планирует вложить в обустройство на работу дочери, которая в этом году закончила медицинский колледж.
texts.en:
Irina is 44 years old, not married, and has an adult daughter of the age of 21. After having lived in a civil marriage for 10 years, Irina was left alone. 

In 2002, while looking for a source of income for her small family, Irina began selling men's and women's clothing at the market in the village of Kaindy, using 6000 som (KGS) as her starting capital. Since the trade was not very profitable, Irina sold off her inventory and from 2006 to 2007 worked as a saleswoman at a store. As her next step, Irina decided to lease a nearby shop that sells detergents, soaps, and cosmetics. Thanks to her tenacity, persistence, and daily work, Irina was able to develop her business, using the profits to buy an apartment in the village. 

In order to broaden the assortment of goods, and also as she intends to purchase the space where she trades, Irina turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS). Irina plans to invest the income from the loan in arranging work for her daughter, who graduated from college of medicine this year.

loans.use: to expand the range of products in her shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La señora Ruth  tiene 38, casada con 5 hijos todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas, frazadas, y otros artículos, ella ofrece sus productos a distintas oficinas, domicilios a crédito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La señora Ruth  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de mercadería variada como edredones por mayor ya que  esta época tiene mucha demanda y ella desea surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, La señora Ruth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ruth, 38, is married and has five children who are school-age. She works by selling a variety of quilts, sheets, blankets, and other items. She sells her products to diverse offices and homes on credit.

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Ruth is going to use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise such as wholesale quilts because right now there is a large demand and she wants to stock her business. She is requesting this loan because she took some orders and doesn't have the necessary capital for the products. Ruth faces challenges such as competition and a high demand this season. She is going to use the profits to increase her merchandise and also her sales.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quilting merchandise.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una joven de 28 años de edad en un estado civil en unión libre y madre de 2 hijos los cual viven y depende de ellos. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo tanto moral como financiero. Sus clientes son los vecinos, pulperías, comerciantes e intermediarios de la zona y aledañas a donde está ubicada su casa de habitación.

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, fertilizantes, urea, insecticida, entre otros para dar asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol los cuales necesitan mucha atención y protección con los cuales planea sacar una buena cosecha y un grano atractivo para sus clientes.

Sus planes son incrementar sembrando la tierra que ellos cultivan con mucho mas producto para poder satisfacer la demanda que hoy en día tiene y atraer más clientes ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura. Su sueño como toda madre es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y lograr enviarlos a la universidad para que ellos pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que no pasen por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud pasaron.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 28 year old young woman in a common law marriage and has two children who live with and depend on them.  She has an elementary school education, which she was able to complete thanks to her parents’ financial support.  It was they who taught her to raise corn, beans, and coffee.

She currently raises corn and beans along with her partner who is her only source of moral and financial support.  Her customers are her neighbors, stores, merchants, and intermediaries in the area where she lives and from surrounding areas.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy compost, fertilizer, urea, insecticide, and other things to help and protect her corn and bean crops, which need much attention and protection so she can have a good harvest, attractive to her customers.

Her plans are to increase production in order to satisfy demand and attract new customers because she can have a sure harvest in this way.  Her dream as a mother is to support her children with their studies and be able to send them to university so that they can graduate and not have to face the same situation that she did as a child.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо добросовестная, целеустремлённая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, которое имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Зебинисо была  малообеспеченной и она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхозкультур. После окончания средней школы, Зебинисо вышла замуж на животновода и помогала мужу по животноводству и выращиванием селхозкультур. В основном они занимались скотоводством, то есть из базара покупали скот по низкой цене, на определённое время откармливали  и перепродали по высокой цене. Из-за неблагополучной погоды и климата их бизнес не дал положительных результатов, Поэтому муж Зебенисо уехал на заработки в Федерацию России. До этого семья Зебинисо проживали только на доходы из животноводства. После чего Зебинисо сама начала заниматься животноводством. Зебинисо скот держит за счёт кормов произведённых им самым. На полученный доход от бизнеса Зебинисо хочет улучшить условию своего домохозяйства. В прошлом году (декабрь 2012 года) муж Зебинисо приехал из России и на определённое время помогал жене по ведению бизнеса по скотоводству. В настоящее время муж Зебинисо опять хочет уехать в Россию на заработки. Поэтому Зебинсо обратилась в КИВА и его партнера ИМОН с целью получения займа для покупки авиабилета для мужа, а сама хочет продолжать бизнес по скотоводству.  Зебинисо надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a conscientious, purposeful and hardworking woman. She was born in a village which has good conditions for livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Zebiniso's family had a low income, and since childhood she helped her parents with cattle breeding and field crop cultivation. 

After having finished high school, Zebiniso got married to a livestock breeder, and helped her husband with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. They mainly worked with livestock breeding, that is, they bought cattle at a low price at the market, fattened it for some time and resold it at a higher price. Due to unfavorable weather and climate, their business did not have positive results. Therefore, Zebiniso's husband went to the Russian Federation as a migrant worker. Zebiniso's family lived through this period only on the income from the livestock breeding. After this, Zebiniso started working with livestock breeding on her own. Zebiniso keeps cattle on fodder which she produces herself. For the income received from the business, Zebiniso would like to improve the living conditions of the family. 

Last year (in December 2012), Zebiniso's husband returned from Russia, and for some time he helped his wife in managing the cattle breeding business. Currently, Zebiniso's husband wants to travel to Russia for work again. Therefore, Zebiniso turned to Kiva and its partner IMON with an aim to receive a loan to purchase plane tickets for her husband. She would like to continue her business of cattle breeding. Zebiniso hopes for your charity and mercy.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket for her husband, who wants to go to Russia for work

loans.name: Ana Fabiana

texts.es:
Ana tiene  48 años y vive en la ciudad de Nazca, es madre de 3 hijos de 20, 19 y 14 años a quienes quiere muchísimo, sobre todo porque quiere brindarles una buena calidad de vida, mejor de las que ella tuvo de pequeña.  Es por ello que siempre se esfuerza para poder salir adelante, tal es así que ella con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida y abarrotes,  negocio con el cual solventa los gastos del hogar. Ana trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 21 clientes en el día, ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene buena sazón.

Ana está  muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando podrá comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio y de esta manera mejorar la atención a sus clientes, ello le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño: “Construir su casa de material noble y poder brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, lives in the city of Nazca.  She's the mother of three children, ages 20, 19, and 14.  She loves them very much and wants to give them a good quality of life, better than what she had when she was young.  This is why she always makes the effort to get ahead.

Ana managed to start her business selling food and groceries, with which she pays the household expenses.  She works around 12 hours a day and can serve up to 21 customers.  She thinks she's getting ahead because she's friendly with the customers and her food tastes good.

Ana's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy tables and chairs for her business and improve her customer service.

This will allow her to improve her income and continue growing every day to make her big dream come true: "To build her house of quality materials and be able to give her children a good education."

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 41 años de edad, está casado con Nila  quien es comerciante y no tienen hijos.  Vive en compañía de su esposo y su suegra en la casa de sus suegros. La actividad de Víctor consiste en la venta de gaseosas bien heladas. Constantemente recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su dinero, luego sencillamente coloca las botellas en su refrigerador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes que acuden a su casa en busca de obtener la bebida más refrescante para calmar la sed. Trabaja solo desde hace 2 años y comparte esta función con otro trabajo privado. Está muy contento con su trabajo porque puede estar en contacto constante con sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes eventuales.
