Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para cubrir los principales gastos de su hogar y es por ello que desea establecer una distribuidora de bebidas para ofrecer gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas de diversas marcas para surtir su local de atención.
texts.en:
Víctor is 41 years old and married to Nila, who is a merchant.  They do not have children.  He lives with his wife and mother-in-law in his in-law's home.  

Víctor works selling cold soft drinks.  He constantly receives the representative from the distribution company at his home, who is in charge of taking his order.  The next day they send him the requested quantity and he places the bottles in his refrigerator and waits for his customers to come to his home in search of a refreshing beverage to quench their thirst.  He has only done this work for two years and also works for a private company.  He is very happy with his work because he is in constant contact with his friends, neighbors, and other future customers.  

His business produces good profits, but he feels it is still not enough to cover the main household expenses, so he wants to establish a beverage distribution company to offer sodas and beers at wholesale prices.  He is requesting 1,000 soles.  He feels grateful to all the people who are providing this loan that he needs so that he can meet his objectives.  He promises to make his repayments on time.  He will invest this loan in the purchase of a variety of brands of soda and beer to stock his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of brands of soft drinks and beers.

loans.name: Zilyat

texts.ru: Зилят жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Ее дети учатся и работают. Сама Зилят зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь торговлей. Она недавно открыла продуктовый магазин и уже 4 месяца как продвигает этот бизнес. Она в основном продает масло, сахар, чай, макароны, яйцо, кексы, вафли, шоколад, конфеты, прохладительные напитки и т.д. Ее товар постоянно в спросе и быстро расходится. Ей в в торговле помогают дети. Сейчас Зилят хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов и расширить бизнес. С этим намерением она обратилась за кредитом. Зилят прибыль с деятельности хочет откладывать и в будущем отремонтировав дом, женить своего старшего сына.
texts.en:
Zilyat is a resident of the Gissar region. She is 43 years old. She is married and has four children. Her children study and work. Zilyat herself earns money for living working with retail. She opened a grocery store not long ago, and has developed this business for four months already. She mainly sells butter, sugar, tea, pasta, eggs, biscuits, wafers, chocolate, candy, refreshments and so on. Her goods are constantly in demand and quickly sell out. Her children help her with the business. 

Currently Zilyat would like to increase the assortment of products and expand her business. With this intention she applied for a loan. Zilyat would like to save the income from the business and in the future renovate her house and marry away her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her store, to develop her business

loans.name: Suhrobi

texts.ru: Сухроб молодой активный житель столицы - города Душанбе. Ему 25 лет. Он холост, живет с матерью. Сухроб имеет среднее техническое образование. Он хочет начать собственный бизнес. Сухроб накопил сбережение и теперь обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить микроавтобус марки Hyundai Starex. Он планирует работать по маршрутной линии города и в день делать 5 кругов. Сухроб будет работать с восьми утра до пяти часов вечера. Это прибыльный бизнес, так как в центре города всегда многолюдно и данная услуга очень востребована. Данный кредит позволит Сухробу иметь собственный бизнес, за счет которого он сможет накопить деньги на свою свадьбу. Он будет благодарен за любую помощь.
texts.en:
Suhrobi is a young and active resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his family. Suhrobi has technical secondary education. He would like to start his own business. 

Suhrobi saved up money and currently applied for a loan in order to purchase a minibus of the type Hyundai Starex. He plans to work on the "marshrutka" line of the city and do five rounds per day. Suhrobi will work from the morning to five in the afternoon. This is a profitable business, as there is always a lot of people in the center of the city, and this service is in high demand. 

This loan will allow Suhrobi to have his own business, from which he may save up money for his wedding. He is thankful for any help.

loans.use: to purchase a Hyundai Starex minibus for starting a business

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 36 лет, незамужем, имеет 2 детей (1 сын и 1 дочь). Чолпон развелась с мужем после рождения детей. Соседи ее характеризуют как аккуратную, требовательную и ответственную женщину. У нее среднее образование, в поисках доходов для своей небольшой семьи, Чолпон с 1983 года занимается частным предпринимательством. Арендует небольшое кафе с бильярдной. Стартовала этот бизнес с 10,000 сом KGS.  Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, она смогла развить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Чолпон расширить свой бизнес и привлечь много клиентов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для кафе и бильярдной. Доходы от кредита помогут Чолпон развить ее бизнес, а также полученная прибыль поможет приготовить приданое для дочери на свадьбу.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 36 years old, not married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). Cholpon divorced from her husband after the birth of the children. Her neighbors describe her as an accurate, demanding and responsible woman. She has secondary education. 

In search of income for her small family, Cholpon has worked in private business since 1983. She rents a small cafe with a pool table. She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholpon's persistent work, she was able to develop her business. It brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for covering food and household expenses for the family. The income from the business allowed Cholpon to expand her business and attract many customers. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Cholpon turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of products for her cafe. The income from the loan helps Cholpon develop her business, and also the income received helps prepare a dowry for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en el mercado, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno, arroz con pollo y sopas, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, carne y verduras para el restaurant.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de taxi, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sol y Luna Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Clorinda, 60, is single and has three children.  She works in her business selling food in the market.  She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, chicken and rice, and soups.  She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has had the business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Clorinda's requesting the loan to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables for the restaurant.

The businesses of the other members are a taxi service, photocopying, a grocery store, and food sales.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 45-year-old woman who is married with three children. She makes and sells elei printed materials to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Salome is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy material, stencils, brushes, paint and wooden carved designs. Salome joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, stencils, brushes, paint, wooden carved designs and pay school fees

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is 64 years old. She lives in Spitak city in the Lori region. Marusya is married and she has two sons and a daughter, all of whom are married. Her sons and their families lost their houses, which were destroyed as the result of a very severe earthquake several years ago, and now they live in the Russian Federation. Marusya lives with her retired husband. It has already been seven years since she engaged in the trading business. She sells carpets, bedding, tablecloths, towels, etc. in her rented shop. She buys the needed products from Yerevan wholesale markets once a month.
Marusya asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams as she plans to buy a lot of various kinds of bedding and she also wants to start trading in children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy a lot of various kinds of bedding and start trading in children's clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45  años de edad, está casado con Nelith quien es comerciante y madre de sus 2 hijas. Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijas y su nieta a quienes quiere mucho, juntos habitan cómodamente su casa propia. Juan se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Para cumplir con su labor tiene un espacio alquilado dentro de un establecimiento maderero en donde atiende a sus clientes, además de ello también transforma la madera en piezas de parquet los cuales vende a mayores precios. Trabaja solo desde hace 20 años y esta muy contento por que le permite tener buenas ganancias económicas. Al principio era muy complicado para él realizar este trabajo ya que es muy complicado debido a la intensa competitividad que existe en este rubro, sin embargo gracias al paso del tiempo ha adquirido la experiencia necesaria para consolidar su clientela. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.3000 soles y agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para venderlas y otra parte de la materia prima lo usará para la fabricación de parquet.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and is married to Nelith, who is a merchant. They have two daughters. Juan lives with his wife, daughters and granddaughter, who he loves very much. Together they live comfortably in their own home. Juan works buying and selling lumber. His business is located in a space he rents inside a lumberyard. Here he waits on his customers and converts lumber into pieces of parquet that he then sells at higher prices. He has worked at this business by himself for 20 years and is very happy with it because it provides him with a good income. He says that at first it was very difficult for him to do this work because of the intense competition that exists in this area. However, with the passage of time he says he has acquired the experience necessary to establish a customer base.

Juan is requesting 3000 PEN to buy lumber at wholesale prices. He will sell some of the lumber, and the other part he will use to make parquet. He says that he is grateful to everyone that has brought him this opportunity to access the financing he needs to continue working, and that he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy lumber at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife hopes to have more good customers and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot lives in the village of Azatamut in the Tavush region. He is married and he has a son and a daughter. His wife used to work at the notary office, but now she is on maternity leave and takes care of their children. Ashot works at the woodworking workshop as a sawyer and at the same time he perfectly manages farming. He is raising a cow, two heifers and three piglets. He manages to sell milk, macun (Armenian national dairy product) and meat right from his house. The income is not very big, but Ashot thinks that if he manages to enlarge his farm cattle the profit will be much more. That is why he is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está divorciada del padre de su hija.  Vive en compañía de su hija, sus padres y su hermano en la casa de sus padres. Evelyn se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores de diversos modelos, tallas y colores para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza las ventas de manera personalizada entre sus amigos y familiares. Toda la mercadería que pone a la venta es seleccionada por ella misma. Lleva en este negocio más de 2 años. Le gusta su actividad pues gracias a ella puede generar el dinero que necesita o para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, además su actividad hace que se sienta una mujer  ocupada y productiva. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará más prendas íntimas para que siga realizando su labor.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 23, is a hard-working and diligent woman. She is divorced from the father of her daughter. She lives with her daughter, her parents, and her brother in her parent’s house. 

Evelyn sells various types, sizes, and colors of undergarments for women, men, and children. She offers this personalized service to her friends and relatives. All the merchandise that she sells is selected by her. She has been in this business for more than two years. She likes this job because thanks to it, she can make the money that she needs or she can help support her parents with the family expenses. Her job also makes her feel like a busy and productive woman.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because this way she will feel secure in moving forward with her business. Furthermore, she promises once again to make her installment payments on time. With the amount requested, she will buy more intimate garments so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy undergarments.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia appreciates the previous loan with Kiva that enabled her to make profits to educate her children and improve their living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase a water tank for more resale. She joined Yehu to access more funds.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for more resale

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para mantener el negocio y sus ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la mercadería necesaria para la comida, tales como: carnes, pollo, arroz, frijol, azúcar, verduras, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. Paula que gracias al crédito anterior el negocio ha tenido buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos han incrementado. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Paula has been presented with the need to request a new loan to maintain her business and her income.  This investment will help her to purchase the necessary merchandise for her food, such as meat, chicken, rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

Paula says that thanks to the last loan, her business has had good results since her profits have increased.  The financial condition of her family has improved.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Raffiqan

texts.en:
Raffiqan is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC for her husband's work. He manufactures chains and sells them in the market to fulfill household needs. His net income is not enough to save some amount for future needs. He is providing even basic needs to their family with so many hurdles and challenges. 

He needs some amount to purchase iron coils to make chains. Therefore his wife has requested a loan so that she can help him in purchasing the needed things. This is very important for him to continue his work. She hopes that the loan will be good for her husband's work. She promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She says hello to all Kiva lenders and asks them to pray for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase iron coils to make chains

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda, de 64 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Arminda se dedica a alquilar habitaciones, los cuales ha habilitado en todo su terreno. Inicialmente tenía 4 habitaciones pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado instalar 10 en total. Empezó con este trabajo hace 7 años. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de las reparaciones cuando son necesarias mientras que ella se encarga del acondicionamiento y la limpieza de las habitaciones. Por fortuna le va muy bien en este rubro económico. Adicionalmente vende prendas de vestir de manera eventual. Le gusta su negocio ya que no le ocupa mucho tiempo y tiene un ingreso constante de dinero, además puede ocupar su tiempo libre en otras actividades. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de maderas, clavos, mallas metálicas y listones para terminar de habilitar 2 habitaciones más.
texts.en:
Arminda is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children in the house they own.  Arminda works renting homes, which have been built on her land.  She originally had four houses but with the passage of time she has been able to build 10 in total.  She started with this work seven years ago.  She works together with her husband, who is in charge of repairs when they are needed, while she takes care of the set up and cleaning of the houses.  Thankfully, they have done very well with this business.  She also sells clothing on a part-time basis.  She likes this business since it does not take up much time and has a constant flow of income.  Additionally, she can use her free time for other activities.

At this time, she is requesting 1,000 soles.  She is very excited to know that there are people who can provide financial help to continue developing her business.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of wood, nails, metal netting, and slats to finish building two more houses.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, metal netting, and slats to build two rental houses.

loans.name: Elva Amparo

texts.es:
Doña Elva es una mujer de 42 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante, casada y madre de 2 los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el tercer grado. Con una gran experiencia sobre el mantenimiento, limpieza, abono y corte de café ella lucha diariamente para salir adelante en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos ya que esta actividad es su único medio de ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia. Dicha actividad (siembra y cultivo de café) fue inculcada por sus padres desde su juventud y lo práctica hace más de 20 años y hoy en día de forma propia. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas a corto plazo es poder ahorrar un capital propio y libre para trabajar de manera propia ampliando sus cultivos y entregándose más para de esa forma trabajar y fortalecer el patrimonio familiar que será heredado por sus hijos mismos que en la actualidad se involucran en las actividades del campo.
texts.en:
Elva, age 42, is a tenacious and enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed and get ahead.  She is married and has two children who live under her roof.  She attended primary school up until the third grade.

Together with her husband and their children, and with great experience in maintenance, clearing the fields, fertilizing, and cutting coffee, she struggles every day in order to get ahead.  This business activity is her only source of income to support her family.  Planting and cultivating coffee was instilled in her by her parents when she was young.  She has been doing this for over 20 years, and she now does it in her own way.

She is currently requesting help to buy fertilizer and manure to provide maintenance on her coffee crops.  She will do this so that the harvest will be healthy and profitable, to be able to generate income, to get earnings, and to be able to continue investing in the crops.

Her short term goals are to be able to save her own capital and to have it available to work in her own way, expanding her crops, and giving more of herself to this way of working.  She wants to strengthen the family legacy, which her own children will inherit.  They are now involved in the farming activities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 39-year-old married mother of two. She has worked as a social worker for 17 years. Her low income and her husband's combined together aren't enough to cover their family's increasing needs.

Rania is acquiring her third loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's annual school fees. This loan is very important to her, since she can't save this amount from her monthly income, because of her family's increasing needs and requests.

Her previous loans were also invested in covering such needs, and she was a good borrower. She hopes to develop in her domain to achieve new goals in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's annual tuition fees

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and lives in the village of Goght in the Kotayk region. Elena lives with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandson. Her son has a food business; her daughter-in-law takes care of their child. 

Elena is a very nice and cheerful lady who perfectly manages farming and agriculture with her family. She is a Jack of all trades. The number of cattle on her farm is very large, but she is never tired. She has cows, calves, bulls, piglets, sheep, lambs, goats, kids, and chickens, which give her a great range of farm products to sell: milk, cheese, sour cream, macun (Armenian national dairy product), meat, wool, and eggs. She also has a large vegetable and fruit garden (cucumbers, tomatoes, greens, beans, onions, apples, peaches, plums, grapes, etc.).

With such a large number of cattle, Elena has a serious problem feeding them during the winter. She has decided to buy a large shipment of animal fodder, and she asks for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams for that.

loans.use: to buy a large shipment of animal fodder to feed her cattle during the winter.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana appreciates the previous loan she got from Kiva that helped her get profits from her tailoring business, thus improving her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase fabric, thread, materials and buttons for her business. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, materials and buttons for her business

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 26 years old and lives with her family in Vanadzor. She graduated from Vanadzor Medical College and is a nurse. Liana is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a military serviceman. Now she works at the garrison hospital, in the department of infection, as a nurse. 

Liana has a problem connected with teeth; she needs a course of treatment that is very expensive, and she needs some money now.

Both Liana’s and her husband's salaries hardly cover their family needs and only with a loan can Liana solve her problem. She asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to start her treatment.

loans.use: to solve her dental problems

loans.name: Reyna Esperanza

texts.es:
Reyna es una joven de 29 años de edad en un estado civil en unión libre y madre de 1 hijo el cual vive y depende de ellos. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de café en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo en un terreno que es propio gracias a los ahorros y a DIOS el cual está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan por lo que el mantenimiento a sus cultivos es más fácil incluso su asistencia técnica. 

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para dar asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de café con los cuales planea sacar una buena cosecha y un grano atractivo para sus clientes.

Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que sus cultivos de café mantengan el follaje y el grano sano ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura. Su sueño es como el de toda madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y lograr enviarlo a la universidad para que él pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que no pase por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 29 year old young woman in a common law marriage.  She has one son, who lives with and depends on them.  She has an elementary school education and was able to complete it thanks to her parents’ support.  It was they who taught her to raise corn, beans, and coffee.  She currently raises coffee with her partner who is her only source of support, on a piece of farmland she owns, located where she lives, thanks to her savings and God’s help, and she is able to maintain her crops easily.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy coffee compost, fertilizer, plants, and other things to help with her coffee production, so she can have a good harvest and be more attractive to her customers. 

Her plans are to improve and fertilize the soil on which they farm so that her coffee crops keep their foliage and produce a healthy fruit.  This way they will be able to count on a sure harvest.  Her dream, like that of every mother, is to support his son with his studies so that he will graduate from university and not have to deal with the same situation she had to deal with as a child.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 58-year-old married mother of a single child.

Since 1999, Fatima and her husband have worked in the distillation of herbs. It’s their main source of income to support their family.

This is Fatima’s seventh loan cycle with Kiva partner Al Majmoua. She is requesting it in order to buy special herbs and seeds necessary to increase her production. Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, friends and friends of friends, or anyone interested in such an industry.

Fatima is an expert in her work, and that’s what is keeping her strong in the market. She is still hoping to be financially capable of opening her own factory to produce her products under a registered trademark in the future.

loans.use: To buy special herbs, flowers and bottles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  trabaja como ayundante de albañil, su  nivel de educacion es secundaria, tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz.

Juana trabaja más de 12 horas al dia para cubrir todos los gastos de su familia, de hecho, ella es el único sustento

Necesita crédito para refaccionar un cuarto de su domicilio, comprará estuco, puerta, pintura y ventanas , asi mejorará  su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Juana es tener  su casa propia para ofreser a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana works as a mason’s helper.  She has a junior high school education, has two children, and lives with her parents in La Paz.

Juana works 12 hours a day to cover all the household expenses, in fact she is their only source of support.

She needs this loan to fix up a room in her house.  She will buy stucco, a door, paint, and windows.  This way her quality of life will improve.  Her dream is to have a house of her own so she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that helped educate her children who are in school. She has a kiosk business that is doing very well and she wants to add more stock to her business. She is requesting a loan of KES30,000 to purchase wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for her kiosk business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Sandukht

texts.en:
Sandukht was born in 1964 in Georgia, and when she was 21 years old her family came back to their motherland, where her father built a beautiful house in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. 

For several years Sandukht has worked at the house of culture in their village. She has also worked at the knitting factory. When she got married she became a housewife and she brought up her three nice children (two daughters and a son). Today her daughters are married and they live separately with their families, and her son is now in the military service. 

Sandukht and her husband now have nothing to do but to become fully engaged in farming and agriculture. They cultivate potatoes, beetroot and barley, and on their small farm they also have two cows, a bull, two calves, eight sheep and forty chickens. Sandukht sells all their farm products herself at their village wholesale food market.

She is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to increase the number of her farm cattle. She has already taken a loan once from Nor Horizon and she is sure that this deal with Kiva lenders will be as productive as the previous one with Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to increase the number of her farm cattle.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia is the group leader of this four-person lending group. She lives in the remote area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family. She has three children. All are of school-going age. She is a responsible mother and always tries her best to provide better facilities to her children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. His net income is too low to meet the household needs. 

Rafia's husband owns a french fry shop. His customers love his delicious french fries. Rafia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy potatoes, chilies, spices, oil and ketchup. Rafia will save the profit amount so that her husband can better establish his business. She hopes that thorough this loan her husband would be able to work more efficiently. She is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan.

loans.use: to buy potato, chilies, spices, oil and ketchup

loans.name: Jorge Atilio

texts.es: Jorge de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de futas y verduras vende en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela porque su producto es fresco y a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jorge, 44 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and his son. He travels selling fruits and vegetables in various neighborhoods close to where he lives. He has a lot of client because his products are fresh and at a good price. With the money he earns at work, he will be able to pay some household bills. Jorge is asking for a loan to buy bulk quantities of fruits and vegetables as well as do some repairs on his car since it’s his only work vehicle. He also wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of fruits and vegetables to do some repairs on his car.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of ten children. Jovito has been in the farming business for several years now. 

Jovito is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these supplies, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm. Jovito hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Noralie

texts.en:
Noralie is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Noralie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Noralie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Noralie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Noralie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is 44 years old and lives in Gavar, a city in the region of Gegharkunik. He is married and has two sons. Stepan’s wife works as a teacher at the local school of the arts. Stepan is trained in the veterinary speciality, but he has never worked in his specialty. With the passing of time, he has become an auto mechanic. He works in a rented space where he provides different car-related services. His garage is very popular in his native city and he can remember no time that he was left without work.

Stepan asks for a loan of 500,000 Aremnian drams (AMD) in order to buy some tools and paints that he needs for his everyday repairing and reconstructing jobs.

loans.use: to buy some tools and paints for his business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is very thankful for the loans previously lent to her. She used her loans in her business, and this gave her a good reward. Her income from business assisted her family financially. She used the loan not just in her variety store but also in her food stall. Her husband is also working to help her provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes to expand her business and dreams that her family will always remain in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Vaimoso

texts.en:
Vaimoso is 29 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei (traditional printed fabric) to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Vaimoso has requested a loan to buy stencils, materials, paints, brushes and a wooden board design for her printing. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy stencils, materials, paints, brushes and a wooden board design

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with 2 children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school.  She used to sell palm fruit but currently Sarah sells saucepans in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about 2 years now. Her husband is a contractor.

Sarah's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  Sarah will use the loan to increase her existing saucepan capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Sarah plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing saucepan capacity

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is married with 1 child. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school.  She use to sell palm fruit but currently Mavis sells bowls and plates in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about  2 years now. Her husband is a mechanic.

Mavis' income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  Mavis will use the loan to increase her existing bowl and plate  capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Mavis plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing bowl and plate  capacity

loans.name: Jose Sifredo

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura de autos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, tiene mucha clientela por ser amable y realizar un buen trabajo, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar toda las herramientas necesarias como electrodos, pinturas, compresor, etc. ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene podrá seguir dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: José is 41 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family. He has a repair shop for car bodywork and painting cars. His business has been located in his home for the last 5 years. He has a large clientele because he is friendly and does a good job. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy all of the tools he needs, like electrodes, paints, a compressor, etc., as this is his only source of work. With his earnings he will be able to keep giving his family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy electrodes, paints, a compressor, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Emerita

texts.es: Sonia de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas,etc. por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hijo.
texts.en: Sonia, 46 years old, lives in her own home with her son. She’s been working selling clothes for a few years. Her business is in the market close to where she lives. Sonia is asking for a loan to buy more blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, etc. in bulk in order to be able to continue her business and also give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality.
 
With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kit, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kit, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food

loans.name: Los Claveles De Poques Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LOS CLAVELES DE POQUES, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Poques, distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa Juana tiene 46 años de edad y es separada, la socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza y engorde de animales como ganados, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus vacas para luego venderlas  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma apoyar a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Los Claveles de Poques (The Carnations of Poques). This bank is located in the community of Poques, Lamay district, Calca province, and department of Cusco.  

The member Luisa Juana is 46 years old and is separated. She alternates her daily activities between raising and feeding animals such as cows. She works a good amount of time at this job which is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts in each day. She raises cattle in order to later to clients who order them. She is a responsible person and wants to be able to continue working in her business in order to support her family. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy feed for her animals. 

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a small-scale food vender who sells rice porridge and bread in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has one  child.  Her husband is a mason.

Hannah has been working as a food vender for close to 2 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice porridge and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food and bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice porridge and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Debner

texts.es: Debner, de 53 años de edad, está casado con Daysi quien es ama de casa y madre de sus hijos. Juntos habitan la casa de sus padres en compañía de su papá, su hermana y sus dos sobrinos. Debner se dedica al transporte público, para eso cuenta con 2 mototaxis que compró con su propio capital. Hace 5 años que viene realizando este oficio, recorriendo las calles de la ciudad en busca de sus clientes a los que brinda su servicio de manera amable, cordial y llevándolos a su destino de manera segura. Un vehículo es conducido por él mismo mientras que otro lo alquila diariamente a un chofer de su barrio a cambio de un pago fijo que recibe al terminar la jornada laboral. Le gusta su trabajo pues le brinda los ingresos económicos que necesita, además esta labor le permite tener un oficio ya que no conseguía ningún empleo y ahora trabaja de manera independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte público en la ciudad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos como llantas, sistema de arrastre y pagará el servicio del mecánico por la refacción de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Debner is 53 years old and is married to Daysi, who is a housewife and the mother of their children. They live together in the house of her parents, together with her father, sister and two cousins.

Debner has a public transport business. He owns 2 motorcycle taxis that he paid with his own money. He has been in this line of business for 5 years, traversing the city streets looking for customers, whom he serves kindly, cordially and taking them to their destination in a safe way. One vehicle is driven by him, while the other is leased to a driver in his neighbourhood who gives him a fixed payment at the end of the working day. He likes his job since it brings him the income he needs. He is also happy to have work, which he had previously difficulty finding, and likes to work independently. His work is quite profitable due to the high demand of public transport in the city.

In this opportunity he is requesting PEN 2000, and he is thankful to all lenders who are helping him reach his objectives. He commits to paying it back precisely in time. With the amount requested he will buy spare parts, such as tires and a traction system, as well as pay the mechanic for other parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, such as tires and a traction system, as well as paying the mechanic.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta continua con la agricultura entonces ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra  maíz, papas, cebada, trigo y otros productos secos, ella continua con la venta de productos secos y con llevar sus productos a las ciudades de Challabamba y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierra de cultivo. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.

Asunta nació en la ciudad de Calca, pero vive en la comunidad Jajahuana (esta comunidad se encuentra en el distrito de Challabamba, dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo y el departamento de Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Ella pertenece a Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Banco Comunal y sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y la ganadería.
texts.en:
Asunta still works in agriculture. She has several fields where she grows corn, potatoes, barley, wheat, and other dry goods. She still sells her products and brings them to the cities of Challabamba and Cusco. 

Currently she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer in order to grow crops. She’s happy to get the loan and promises to make prompt payments. 

Asunta was born in the city of Calca, but she lives in the town of Jajahuana (which is the in the Challabamba district, in the middle of the Paucartambo province and the department of Cusco, Peru).  She’s 56 years old and married with six children. She belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Banco Comunal (Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank). Her main economic activities are agriculture and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fely Conchita

texts.en:
Fely Conchita, 49 years old, is married and they are blessed with four children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost 15 years, and she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP per hog when she sells.

Due to a lack of capital, she wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her hog raising business will continue to grow so that her business will become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar con la venta de productos de uso personal y mariscos, asimismo con ello lograr obtener mejores ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar, talcos, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, también pescado, camarones, entre otros. 
Cuenta la Sra. Juana que el crédito anterior le ayudo de manera favorable, porque logro establecer bien su negocio de venta de mariscos y ampliar las ventas. Su deseo es tener su propio local, agregar otro tipo de  productos y generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana requires a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue with the sale of personal use products and seafood and thus obtain better earnings. This investment will help her to buy powders, deodorants, lotions, creams, and also fish, shrimp and other items.

Juana says that the previous loan helped in her a favorable manner, because she was able to establish her seafood sales business well and expand sales. Her wish is to have her own store, to add other types of products and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy powders, deodorants, lotions, creams, and also fish, shrimp and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 2 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por que su mercaderia es fresca  y a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas pescado por mayor y una hielera donde guarda su mercaderia, para poder seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his mother and his wife.  He has been selling fish for two years.  He has his business at his house.  He has a lot of clientele because his merchandise is fresh and at a good price.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more fish wholesale and to buy a cooler where he can keep his merchandise.  He will do this to be able to continue with his business, to get better earnings, and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC for her husband's work. He sell embroidery materials in the market to fulfill household needs. His net income is too low to save even a single penny. Even providing basic needs to her family presents many hurdles and challenges. Samina is a mother of six children, and three of their sons are doing small jobs. They are living in a small house with huge family.

Samina's husband needs the loan amount to purchase embroidery materials including threads, buttons, laces and ribbons. Therefore his wife has requested a loan so that she can help him in purchasing the needful things. This is very important for him to continue his work. She hopes that the loan will be good for her husband's work. She promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She says hello to all Kiva lenders, and asks them to pray for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials including threads, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla- Habib Group

texts.en:
Habib is a 37-years-old resident of Kalwere. He is married with three children. However, he also takes care of two widows and their children by providing them with basic needs, since they lost their husbands who were responsible for taking care of them.

Habib drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job in 2003 after failing to find formal employment, yet still needing to meet the growing needs of his family. Habib mostly deals in town transportation service.

His dream is to have another taxi so that he can earn higher wages. This would help him provide the best for his family and many dependents.

His major challenge is lack of enough money to purchase a taxi, therefore he needs a loan to help him purchase a taxi. Habib is very hardworking and honest according to his colleagues. He will use the loan to purchase a taxi for himself.

Habib confided that if he had enough funds, he would quit being a taxi driver and settle down as a businessman. However, he thanks UGAFODE for giving them loans at reduced rates.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand taxi

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar, 49 years old, is married. She and her husband are blessed with three school-aged children. They live in the mountainous region of Isabela Province. Pilar has raised hogs for 10 years, and she wants to expand her piggery. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vitamins and feeds for her business. She hopes that she can provide a quality living for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 2 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Sonia, age 43, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items, beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  She has had her business for two years, and it has gifted her with sales experience that allows her to get the best profits.  The business is located at her home in a very busy place.  It is well-known by the neighbors in the area.  She has made a lot of customers as she has the store stocked.

She wants to increase her business and make a new investment.  However she needs capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store.  She affirms that she will repay the debt, and she trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Joyet

texts.en:
Joyet is a married woman with three children. She is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Joyet has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Joyet has been in this business for 13 years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married to a city councilor. She has 4 children. A university graduate, Grace currently sells provisions in Whindo (near Takoradi). She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

With over 10 years of experience in her trade, Grace sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. However, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales.  Grace wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provision enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, indirectly helping to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married to a driver. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses, as well as to save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Emelia currently sells provisions in Whindo (near Takoradi). 

With over six months of experience in this trade, Emelia sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.  

Emelia wants to make her business self-sustaining as soon as possible. To this end, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provisions enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, helping her boost overall sales.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Rehema sells cooked food from her home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase foodstuffs such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, le surge la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar sus ingresos, cosechas y de las ganancias logro comprar dos terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Gracias a esta inversión las condiciones económicas han mejorado, mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y están muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he needs money to start growing basic grains.  The investment will help him buy soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and other agricultural inputs.

The previous loan allowed him to increase his income and harvests.  With his profits he managed to buy two calves to fatten and sell.  Thanks to this investment his economic situation has improved.  He supports the same family group and they're all very healthy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC to help support her husband's work. He owns a garment shop in the market. He has excellent tailoring skills so he stitches garments and sells dresses for a profit. His customers appreciate his work. 

Bushra is a responsible mother of three sons and five daughters. She is going through serious financial issues because it is so difficult to manage a large family these days. Her husband's income is too low as compared to the family's daily expenses.

Bushra is the group leader of a two-person lending group. Bushra's husband will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a variety of clothes for his business. By doing so, he will be able to continue his work and generate income, which is very important to sustain his family's living. Bushra is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. 

Lilia has a small plantation and grows taro and banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lilia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, file and barbed wire for her farming. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Lilia hopes to expand her plantation.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, file and barbed wire

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.en:
Ahrorjon is a 40-year-old man. He is married and the father of two adult children. 

Ahrorjon has been busy with farming and animal husbandry for nine years. Thanks to his good experience in this field, he grows wheat and potatoes with a high degree of success. He also fattens cattle, but it brings in little income. It does not allow him to provide for the needs of his family and repair his house, because his family is large and needs a big and comfortable house. This year he is going to repair house with modern planning. His elder son wants to marry a lovely girl this year, and they will live in the house after it is repaired.

This loan will help him buy building materials to repair the house. In this way, he will provide a high quality living condition for his family and put an end to the problems with this house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his old house

loans.name: Developmental  Consideration2 Group

texts.en:
Justus is a second-time borrower in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of UGX 500,000 was used for the purpose of repairing his fridge so that he could increase his sales in the shop. He runs a retail shop in the city outskirts, and he has borrowed a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to add more stock of soft drinks. Soft drinks are highly sought after, especially now that it is the dry season. 

Justus is a married man with two kids, one of whom goes to school. He has started up a small saloon to increase his income and also be able to save more. This helps him to improve his current standard of living and save for the future. He is planning to buy a piece of land and build a house for his family, reducing his rent expenses so as to increase his savings. He is so grateful to the funders for the great job they do of providing loans to low-income earners.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is a 29-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working in the agricultural sector for 11 years. Hashim is a hard worker. He is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Hashim takes good care of his farm and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Hashim is requesting a loan of $3,000 US. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizers (mainly organic) and renovate the storage facility of his farm. Hashim expects that this loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy livestock and develop his farm.

The story of Hashim and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy necessary fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Джумагул молодая замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Дж.Руми. Ей 26 лет. Она является матерью двоих детей. Ее муж скотовод и земледелец. Он обеспечивает семью за счет дохода с этих деятельностей. Джумагул домохозяйка. Она умеет вышивать женские национальные платья. Теперь она хотела бы применить свои способности на деле. Но для этого ей нужна швейная машинка. С такой целью Джумагул обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить швейную машинку и начать собственное швейное дело. Джумагул хочет сама зарабатывать на жизнь и быть независимой женщиной. Швейный бизнес в их местности считается прибыльным бизнесом, так как сельские женщины предпочитают шить платья на заказ у портних. Джумагул планирует принимать заказы у себя дома. Прибыль с бизнеса она хочет потратить на улучшение быта.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a young and married woman, who is living in the J.Rumy region. She is 26 years old. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a cattle breeder and farmer. He supports the family through the income from these activities. 

Jumagul is a housewife. She knows how to sew women's national dresses. Currently she would like to apply her skills in practice. But to do this she needs a sewing machine. With this aim, Jumagul applied for a loan, in order to purchase a sewing machine and start her own sewing business. Jumagul wants to earn money for living herself and to be an independent woman. 

The sewing business is a profitable business in their area, as the village women prefer to sew dresses on order from seamstresses. Jumagul plans to take orders at her home. She would like to spend the income from the business on improving everyday life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to start a sewing business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married to a driver. She has one child. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

As a primary school graduate, Rebecca sold vegetables and currently sells provisions in Whindo (near Takoradi). With over five years of experience in this trade, Rebecca sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more provisions, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.  Rebecca wants to make her store a success.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, helping her boost overall sales

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda is the group leader of this three-person lending group. She is 34 years old and a very responsible woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. His income plays a vital role in fulfilling the family’s needs. He is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.

He wants to repair it as soon as possible so that he can continue generating income. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Maqsooda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Maqsooda is so much thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 67 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero vive con su esposo y su última hija en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a alquilar locales usados para negocios o actividades comerciales. Ha establecido en el frontis de su terreno dos locales que alquila mensualmente. Para la construcción de estos ambientes contó con el apoyo de su esposo, sus hijos y en ocasiones algunos obreros. Lleva en esta actividad más de 15 años. Actualmente se encuentra también en pleno acondicionamiento de habitaciones para alquiler y de esta forma generar otra fuente de ingresos económicos que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Le agrada su trabajo porque puede recibir ingresos diarios y buenas ganancias económicas sin que ella realice mucho esfuerzo y en la comodidad de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pintura, brochas y renovará la cerradura del local que alquila.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 67 years old, is married and has four children, but she lives with her husband and their youngest daughter in a house they own. Yolanda makes a living from renting out spaces for businesses or commercial activities. She has established two spaces at the front of her land that she rents out on a monthly basis. 

For the construction of these spaces she counts on the support of her husband, her children and sometimes a few workers. She has had this business for more than fifteen years. She is currently also in the process of preparing rooms for rental and in this way she will generate another source of financial income to help cover her household expenses. She likes her work because she is able to receive daily income and good financial earnings without a lot of effort and from the comfort of her home.

At this time she is requesting 1200 Peruvian nuevos soles. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to access the loan that she needs to continue achieving her goals. She also pledges to make her payments in a punctual manner. With the requested amount, she will buy paint and brushes, and she will replace the lock on a space that she is renting out.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes and a lock to renovate one of the spaces that she rents out.

loans.name: Olinda Suyapa

texts.es:
Olinda es una joven de 27 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven juntos en familia. Tiene un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público pero no ejerce su profesión y su compañero de hogar trabaja emigro hace un tiempo hacia EE.UU para buscar una mejor condición de vida y poder ayudar a su pareja con los cultivos de café entre otros. Ella tiene un cultivo de café el cual hasta hoy en día al cual le ha dedicado 3 años de trabajo siendo sus padres y su compañero de hogar estando en honduras los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. En sus cultivos solo se involucra ella y sus suegros para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos como: limpieza, abono, fertilización y en temporada la parte de recolección. 

Olinda hoy en día está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, urea foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya.

Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad abriendo puertas que en estos momentos están cerradas y creando oportunidades de empleo a todas las personas que lo necesiten por medio de la tierra que ella hoy en día trabaja ya que es su único patrimonio para dejarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 27 year old young woman. She’s a housewife and a farmer; she’s married and has two children who live at home. She has a college education, graduating with a degree in merchandising and accounting though she’s not currently working in that profession. A while ago her partner emigrated to the United States to seek a better quality of life, be able to support his wife's coffee production, and other reasons. 

She has a coffee farm which she’s had for three years. It was her parents and her partner in Honduras who taught her how to work the land. Only she and her in-laws are involved in the agricultural work activities like cleaning, composting, fertilizing and harvesting.

Currently Olinda is asking for help in buying fertilizer, manure, and chemicals used in growing coffee. If she doesn’t do regular maintenance, there might be rust damage.  

She dreams of educating her children so that they can have a better quality of life and better work opportunities. She wants to be able to open doors in society that are now closed and to and create job opportunities for all the people who need them through the land she works since this is the only thing she has to leave her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like to be able to maintain and clean her coffee farm.

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.ru:
Назрулло житель города Дангара. Ему 57 лет. У него высшее образование. По профессии он учитель. Однако последние 7 лет Назрулло занимается торговым бизнесом. Назрулло женат, имеет сына и дочь, которые являются учениками средней школы. 
Рядом с домом Назрулло имеет магазин, где он вместе с женой занимается продажей продуктов питания. В частности он в своем магазине продает чай, сахар, соль, масло, конфеты, печенье, макароны и т.д., а также хозяйственные товары. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Назрулло просит кредит. Он хочет купить разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания для привлечения большего количества клиентов.
texts.en:
Nazrullo is a resident of the city of Dangara. He is 57 years old and has higher education. He is a teacher by profession. However, for the last 7 years Nazrullo has been engaged in retail. Nazrullo is married and has a son and a daughter who are high school students.

Next to their home, Nazrullo has a store where he and his wife sell food products. At his store he in particular sells tea, sugar, salt, butter, candy, cookies, pasta and so on, and also household goods. In order to increase turnover, Nazrullo requests a loan. He wants to purchase a varied assortment of food product in order to attract a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to increase turnover

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is 40 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, flour, rice, etc. She has been doing this for many years. Mele needs a loan to buy a freezer, chicken, rice, lamb chops, sugar, flour, beer and cigarettes for her store. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, chicken, rice, lamb chops, sugar, flour, beer and cigarettes

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine to sell, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and take care of her family’s needs. Sylvia hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a very powerful entrepreneur. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул является скотоводом, проживающим в районе Дангара. Она в течение 6 лет занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Сафаргул замужем. Ей 26 лет. У нее двое маленьких детей. Ее муж работает мастером, предоставляющим услуги по ремонту домов. Сама Сафаргул разводит крупнорогатый скот для дальнейшей продажи. Ей в закупе и продаже скота помогает муж. Сейчас для развития бизнеса Сафаргулу необходимо увеличить поголовье скота. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить коров и телят для продвижения деятельности.
texts.en:
Safargul is a cattle breeder who is living in the Dangara region. She has worked with breeding cattle for a period of 6 years. Safargul is married. She is 26 years old and has two small children. Her husband works as a master builder, offering a service of repairing houses. 

Safargul breeds cattle for further sale. Her husband helps her in buying and reselling cattle. Currently, in order to develop the business, it is necessary for Safargul to increase the number of cattle. She requests a loan to purchase cows and calves to advance the business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves in order to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 49 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her video library, which sells music CDs and movies. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more video movies and music tapes to sell, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Getrude hopes that in the future, she will be able to live a good life.
