Toda su vida ha sido ama de casa, pero con la idea de generar ingresos para apoyar la carga económica de su hogar, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas como pasteles, empanadas, tortas de chócolo, gaseosas, entre otros, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años y que aprendió de su madre cuando era joven. La cliente es una persona activa, entusiasta, positiva y muy trabajadora. En las mañanas se encarga de las diferentes actividades en su hogar y en las tardes sale a vender sus productos. 
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una fritadora de mayor capacidad, mesas y sillas, e insumos al por mayor (verduras, aceite, pollo), con esto podrá organizar bien su negocio, mejorando la imagen y la percepción de los clientes y así poder aumentar sus ingresos por ventas. Además, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en un restaurante reconocido, que le ofrezca la oportunidad de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y a sus hijos.
texts.en: Libia is 48 years old, married and has four children. All of her life she has been a housewife, but with the idea of earning income to support the family finances, she decided to start her own business selling food like cakes, empanadas, tortas and soft drinks. She has been doing this for eight years and learned about cooking from her mother when she was young. Libia is an active, enthusiastic, positive and very hardworking person. In the mornings she takes care of various household tasks, and in the afternoons she sells her products. She is requesting the loan to purchase a bigger fryer, tables and chair, and wholesale ingredients like vegetables, oil and chicken. With these items, she will be able to better organize her business, improving its image and her customers' perception, as well as increase her sales and income. Libia dreams of growing her business until it becomes a recognized restaurant, which will give her the opportunity to provide a better quality of life for her husband and children.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger fryer, tables, chairs and wholesale ingredients (vegetables, oil, chicken).

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей выращивает овощи в теплицах. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту он установил отопительную систему и смог получить хороший ранний урожай огурцов и помидоров. Однако, из-за низких цен Сергей не получил ожидаемую прибыль. Сейчас Сергей садит семена для второго урожая. Он просит кредт в 10,000 гривен для закупки семян, удобрения и дров для отопления. Благодаря второму урожаю, он сможет собирать и продавать овощи до Рождества и таким образом получать дополнительную прибыль. 

Помимо выращивания овощей, Сергей вместе со своей женой начали новый бизнес - продажа продуктов питания. Они купили киоск, завезли товар и начинают приобретать первых клиентов, продавая как то что они вырастили сами в теплицах, так и упакованные продукты питания - крупы, сахар, чай,пр.
texts.en: Sergei grows vegetables in greenhouses. Thanks to a previous loan he installed a heating system and had a good harvest of early cucumbers and tomatoes. However, because of low prices Sergei didn't receive the income he expected. Sergei is now planting seeds for a second harvest. He is asking for a 10,000 hryvnia loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and wood for heating. Thanks to the second planting he can harvest and sell vegetables until Christmas and thus earn additional income. Beside growing vegetables, Sergei and his wife also started a new business - selling groceries. They bought a kiosk, brought in goods, and are beginning to earn their first clients, as they sell both what they grew themselves in the greenhouses, and packaged groceries such as grains, sugar, tea, etc.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his second crop

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en: Bulus is a dedicated maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in Tsirya village in Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his standard of living.  Like all Babban Gona members,he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income. Bulus looks forward to experiencing positive changes in his life as a result of the loan and improving his standard of living. His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double their yield and incomes

loans.name: Samiaila

texts.en: Samiaila is a maize farmer from Chino Village, Kaduna State. With the services Samiaila has been receiving as a Babban Gona member, he believes he will soon be liberated from poverty, which has plagued his family. He finally has access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, this season, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield and can also expect to earn up to $1,350/ha. With his increased earnings, he plans to send his children educate his children and improve his family’s standard of living. With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double their yield and incomes

loans.name: Ruth Beatriz

texts.es:
Ruth, tiene 20 años de edad, está acompañada y su compañero de vida tiene 22 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo, el cual tiene tres años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, dicha actividad lo aprendió de una tía y lo realiza todos los días, cuenta con un año de poseer el negocio. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá  comprar variedad de mercadería en cuanto a la medicina natural y química. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
El sueño de la Sra. Ruth es fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth is 20 years old and in a relationship. Her life companion is 22 years old and they have one child who is three years old. Ruth sells natural medicines and learned this trade from an aunt. She works every day and has been in business for one year.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of merchandise, including natural and chemical medicines. This investment will help her to increase her inventory and obtain more income.

Sra. Ruth’s dream is to strengthen her business even more so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical medicines.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru: Наталья торгует женской одеждой - трикотажем, платьями, кофтами, блузами и пр. Имеет свой большой киоск на рынке Юлана. Торгует более пяти лет на одном месте и наработала постоянных клиентов. Просит предоставить кредит в размере 12,000 гривен на закупку осеннего товара -ветровок и курток. Наталья говорит, что готовится к осени нужно летом. Есть хорошие предложения у нового поставщика одежды и надо деньги, чтобы выкупить товар оптом. Наталья проживает в своем доме с мужем и сыном, семья крепкая.
texts.en: Natalia sells women's clothing - knitted wear, dresses, blouses, sweaters, etc. She has a large kiosk at the Yulana market. She has been selling for over five years at the same place, and has earned regular customers. She is asking for a 12,000 hryvnia loan to buy fall goods - windbreakers and jackets. Natalia says you need to prepare for fall in the summer. She has good offers from a new clothing wholesaler and needs money to buy the goods. Natalia lives in her own home with her husband and son. The family is strong.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the fall season in bulk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es estudiante de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene cuatro hermanos solo su papa trabaja, quien es constructor.
Sonia comenta que su meta es recibirse en su carrera para tener un ingreso mejor y ayudarle a su familia, ya que sabe que la vida es muy dura y quiere poder sentirse útil.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y comenta que siempre le gusto eso ya que puede ayudar a las personas que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y así poder cubrir esto y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Sonia is a student from the city of Villarrica. She has four siblings, but only her father works. He is a builder.

Sonia says that her goal is to obtain a degree so that she can have more income and help her family. She knows that life can be very hard, so she wants to feel useful. Sonia is studying for a nursing degree and says that she has always enjoyed helping people who are in need. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. By covering this expense, she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 33-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda .He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. He is a farmer dealing in maize and groundnut production and the business has been lucrative despite the hardship of unpredictable weather changes. 

His dreams are to complete his house and venture into modern farming methods. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay workers who are clearing the bush in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing the bush in preparation for the next season.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 44-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after four of his children.He deals in a transport business and also earns a salary as a civil servant. His business is located in a rural area and he has the challenges of poor roads and the seasonal nature of the business.

His dreams are to own at least three motorcycles for his transport business and to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications. Salim intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village of Kveda Chkhorotsku. She is 54 years old, married and lives with her family, including her husband, two grown sons, daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. 

Mzia is leading the agribusiness of the family. Her spouse helps. They own calves and three milk cows, the milk of which is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. Also, they have agricultural land where nuts and maize are grown. Mzia sells the harvest locally. Along with the aforementioned activities, Mzia’s husband works as a constructor at the local stone workshop and receives a small monthly income. 

Mzia plans to purchase nuts with her received startup credit. The price of nuts is low now because of harvest season. She will sell them after four or five months, when the price increases. Mzia plans to use the gained profit in the same business and increase the turnover gradually. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of nuts to resell

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es:
Lina, a sus 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 14 años. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar en diferentes talleres y empresas de confección, pero, desde hace 5 años inició su propio taller, cuyo objetivo es prestar servicio de confección a terceros. Actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de 7 empleadas, a las cuales les paga de acuerdo a la labor desempeñada.  Esto le ha permitido adquirir los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego del abandono del papá de su hijo. Lina es una mujer organizada, juiciosa, emprendedora y pujante, lucha incansablemente por sacar adelante a su hijo. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una máquina cerradora de codo; con esta máquina podrá aumentar su producción y agilizar en la entrega del producto, además tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar su clientela, pues prestaría un servicio más completo y entregaría un producto con mejores terminaciones, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de sus ingresos. 
Lina sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, poder comprar nuevas y mejores máquinas para poder cumplir con todos los pedidos de sus clientes, también tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su hijo una excelente educación, para que tenga un futuro más próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old. She is a single mother with a 14 year old son. For all of her working life, she has worked in different workshops and sewing businesses, but 5 years ago she started her own workshop with the objective of providing sewing services to others. She currently has 7 employees, whom she pays according to the work they do. This has allowed her to provide for her family’s basic necessities, since all of the economic responsibility fell to her when she was abandoned by her son’s father. 

Lina is an organized person, sensible, entrepreneurial, and thriving. She works tirelessly to help her son get ahead in life. This is what motivates her to request the loan, with the goal of buying a double chain stitch sewing machine. With this machine she will be able to increase her production and turn in her products more quickly. She will also have the possibility of increasing her number of clients because she will be able to provide more complete service and she would turn in a product with better finishes, which will be reflected in an increase in her income.

Lina dreams of growing her business and of being able to buy new and better machines so that she can comply with all of the requests from her clients. She would also have the opportunity to improve her income and give her son and excellent education so that he can have a more prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy a double chain stitch sewing machine

loans.name: Timur

texts.en:
Timur is 28 years old. He works as an accountant in an organization. He has been doing this work for a year. He is not married and lives with his parents in the house which was built with the great dedication of his father. 

His house is old, as it was built many years ago, and it needs some repairs. In winter it has too much heat loss through windows and doors due to the damages to them. Therefore, Timur plans to repair his house. He has decided to replace his windows and doors and to repair the walls and floors. He needs about 2,200 USD to cover the cost of new windows and doors, as well as the costs of hired workers.

loans.use: To buy windows and doors and cover the costs of hired workers.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona que está esforzándose por ser un gran profesional y el día de mañana sea útil a las personas de su comunidad.
Victor está estudiando la carrera de Análisis de sistemas, lo cual es una carrera que le gusta mucho. El está esforzándose mucho y quiere destacarse siempre en lo que hace.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma podrá seguir invirtiendo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victor is from the city of Pilar. He is striving to become a successful professional so that one day he can become useful to the people in his community.

Victor is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis since he greatly enjoys this field. He is working very hard and wants to stand out in his chosen career. Victor is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the payment of his fees. This will enable him to continue investing in his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram is 38-years-old and is married with two sons. Her husband is a hire driver. Tram has been running a business of selling old clothes for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Tram is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of used clothes to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to invest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 41-year-old married woman living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been in the cloth business for seven years and with the proceeds she has been able to build rental houses where she now earns extra income.  Tenants delaying payments and ever changing customer preferences are her major challenges while her dream is to educate her children up to University.

Gertrude intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила имеет развитый бизнес  с несколькими торговыми точками на рынке. Она умело управляет бизнесом, поэтому дела идут хорошо. Прошлый раз Людмила брала кредит на расширение бизнеса - заполнение нового киоска товаром. Сейчас просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21,000 гривен на закупку канцтоваров к школьному сезону. 
В бизнесе помогает муж, есть дочь школьница. Этим летом всей семьей смогли поехать на отдых на море в Крым.
texts.en: Ludmila has developed a business with several outlets at the market. She skillfully manages the business, so things are going well. Last time, Ludmila took out a loan in order to expand the business by filling a new kiosk with merchandise. Currently, she has requested a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia for the purchase of stationery for the school season. Her husband helps her with the business, and she has a school-age daughter. This summer, the whole family was able to go on vacation at sea in Crimea.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 21-years-old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family which consists of six members. He is currently studying for a Bachelor of Mechanical Design in his second year. He is planning to expand his studies in the future and to be a Mechanical Engineer. Ali is facing financial problems which is not permitting him to pay for his school fees. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his semeser fees

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris, 38-years-old, is married and lives with his wife, parents and two children in the village of Mukhrani. Boris is a construction worker in the Road Department and his spouse works as a baker at the local bakery.  They earn a small monthly income. 

Boris is a very enthusiastic young man and wants to generate more income and help the family. The existing income, however, is not enough to cover everyday expenses.  Therefore, Boris decided to start up a grocery store but he found that he didn't have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Boris has been unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions as they require a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. 

Boris has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start up loans with easy terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. With a loan of 5,000 USD Boris will purchase building materials and construct a store. He will also purchase basic groceries to stock it. Boris will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan he expects to improve his income and give his family members a better standard of living.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга торгует канцтоварами и печатной продукцией. Имеет на рынке в Павлограде уже две точки продаж. Прошлый кредит брала на закупку товара для второй точки. Бизнес пошел хорошо, спрос увеличился. В этот раз просит предоставтиь  ей кредит на закупку канцтоваров к школьному сезону. Сезонно вырос спрос и ей не обойтись своими средствами. 

Ольга проживает с мужем и взрослым сыном в 2-х комнатной квартире, семья дружная, взрослая дочь живёт со своей семьёй отдельно. Ольга планирует сделать ремонт в квартире.
texts.en: Olga sells office supplies and printed materials. She has two outlets at the market in Pavlograd. Last time, she took out a loan to purchase merchandise for the second outlet. Business was good, and demand has increased. This time, she has requested a loan for the purchase of stationery for the school season.  Demand has grown this season, and she does not have sufficient means. Olga lives with her husband and adult son in a 2-room apartment.  The family is close-knit.  Her adult daughter lives separately with her own family. Olga plans to repair her apartment.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Ateme

texts.fr: Atème,veuve âgée de 51 ans ,elle a 9 enfants d'autres sont à l'école ,ses 2 garçons l'ainé et son frère sont dans la région de kaolack et 2 filles sont à la maison pour les travaux ménagers.Atème travaille dans une ONG de la région comme femme de ménage ou elle gagne un bon salaire avec lequel elle prend charge toutes les dépense de sa femme et les frais scolaire.Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000f pour acheter un terrain dans la capitale du sud .Elle souhaite d'ici 2015 contuire et habiter dans sa propre maison avec ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ateme is a 51-year-old widow. She has nine children some of whom are in school. Her eldest boy and his brother are in the region of Kaolack and two girls are at home doing the housekeeping.

Atème works in a local NGO as a cleaning lady where she earns a good salary. She takes care of all her own expenses and tuition fees.

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 XOF to buy a plot of land in the southern capital. By 2015, she wishes to live in her own home with her children.

loans.use: buy land

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani is a married woman with one child who goes to school. They live in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the child.

Shani operates a clothes selling business.  She sells at the market to her fellow town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou est un vendeur de mouton, il habite dans les environs du Guichets. Agé de 54 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Avec ce montant il veut acheter des moutons pour les engraisser et ensuite les revendre à ses clients. IL a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans cet activité. Abdou commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il souhaite développer son cheptel pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et être pérenne dans son activité pour ne plus avoir besoin de crédits.
texts.en:
Abdou is a seller of sheep. He lives near the branch office. Aged 54, he is married and a father.

With this loan amount he wants to buy sheep to fatten them and then resell them to his customers. He has an experience of over 15 years in this business. Abdou begins his day at 8 am to finish at 6 pm.

He wants to expand his herd to increase his revenues and improve his family's living conditions. He also wants to become sustainable in his activity and no longer need to rely on credit.

loans.use: Buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of five children, with four in school and one finished. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mahmayunus

texts.ru: Махмаюнус 26-летний женатый молодой человек, проживающий с родителями, женой и двумя дочерьми в районе Шахритус. Он имеет высшее образование. Махмаюнус сейчас собирается открыть лавку по продажам кондитерских изделий. Он уже арендовал лавку размером 3х4 метра на центральном рынке района. Его стартовый капитал составляет 3000 таджикских сомони. Махмаюнус еще просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. На половину суммы кредита и сбережения он хочет купить конфеты и сладости, а на другую часть купить сырье (муку, сахар, маргарин, яйца и т.д.) для выпечки тортов и булочек. Жена и мать Махмаюнуса дома будут печь торты и булочные изделия, а Махмаюнус будет продавать их на своей лавке. Это будет их семейным бизнесом. Благодаря данному кредиту у Махмаюнуса будет прибыльный семейный бизнес, который будет приносит ему ежедневную хорошую выручку.
texts.en: Mahmayunus is a 26-year-old married young man who lives with his parents, his wife and two daughters in the Shahritus district. He has a university education. Mahmayunus is going to open a confectionery shop. He has rented a 3x4 meter shop in the central market area. His start-up capital is 3000 somons. Mahmayunus has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 U.S. dollars. He plans to use half of his loan and savings to buy candy and sweets, and the other half to buy raw materials (flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, etc.) for baking cakes and buns. His wife and mother will bake cakes and pastries at home, and Mahmayunus will sell them at his shop. This will be their family business. Thanks to this loan, Mahmayunus will have a lucrative family business, which will bring him a good income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, margarine, eggs, baking and candy and sweets in order to open a confectionery shop

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 42-years-old, married and lives with his wife, two school age sons and his father in the Sagarejo district. Ramaz is jobless at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region especially among people up to 40 and Ramaz is unable to find a suitable and well-paying job.  Ramaz’s spouse is the only one who makes money in the household, working as an apothecary at the pharmacy. Her monthly wage is approximately $180 which is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses. 

According to the government’s estimate, the family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category and gets small assistance (45 USD per month). As the living conditions are very poor, Ramaz decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions have rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ramaz applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3000 will help Ramaz to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them in return for a service fee. 

Ramaz is very enthusiastic and is a hard working person with a great desire to get ahead. This credit will be a great support for the family. Ramaz is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 29-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store in her community to support her husband financially. 

Khalida sells various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills, and has built a good client base. Her husband’s income is not enough to support the family alone. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she has asked for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand she is seeing consistently. Khalida would like to use part of revenues generated from the loan to meet personal expenses, and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with three children of school age. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Khadija sells snacks from her home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and the lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling loan she has asked for, Khadija wants to buy ingredients including wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business

loans.name: Fajar

texts.en:
Fajar is a 23-year-old vigorous lady; she has been sewing clothes for the past two years. She is an expert in sewing stylish dresses, and uses the income to support her entire family. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she has asked for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues generated to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, and packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: Cipriano es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, tiene 39 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio agricultor y se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años. Empezó su actividad junto a su papa quien lo apoyo mucho para labores de siembra. Con los ingresos que ha obtenido de su cosecha logro comprar terrenos  y ganado que son propiedad de él. Comercializa sus productos  en su pueblo para evitar gastos de transporte. Solicita el prestamo para comprar: un lote de tierra, ya que quiere sembrar,sacar mas cosecha y obtener mayores utilidades.Su expectativa  sembrar, sacar la cosecha y al mismo tiempo que el pasto alimente a su ganado. Este agradecido con kiva y MiCredito por la oportunidad económica ya que podrá cumplir sus propósitos como agricultor.
texts.en:
Cipriano, 39, is from the city of Boaco. He is married, the father of 3 children, and works as a farmer. He has been planting corn and beans for 10 years. He started this work together with his father who supported him a lot in the planting. With his income from harvests, he has been able to buy his own land and cattle. He sells his products in his town in order to avoid transportation costs. 

He asks for a loan to buy a plot of land that he wants to plant so that he can have a bigger harvest and make more money. He expects to plant it, harvest it, and also use the pasture to feed his cattle. He is thankful to Kiva and MiCredito for the financial opportunity, as he will be able to meet his goals as a farmer.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: Monsieur Thierno est un éleveur de montons de profession. Il habite à 7km du Guichet et vient juste de commencer les crédits avec le guichet. Agé de 40 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Thierno a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cet activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des moutons qu'il engraisse et les revendre dans les marchés de sa localité. A l'avenir Thierno souhaite faire de l'embouche bovine pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Thierno is a professional sheep breeder. He lives 7 km from the branch office and just started a credit loan. Aged 40, he is married and a father. 

Thierno has an experience of over 5 years in this business. He starts his day at 8 am to finish at 6 pm. 

He is requesting this loan to buy sheep he then fattens and resells in local markets. In the future Thierno wishes to fatten cattle to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buy sheep and fatten them for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 51-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has responsibility for ten children. He runs a farm, and his major clients are middle-men who come to his land to get produce.

George's major challenge is unpredictable weather. He wants to become a model farmer in the region, and educate his children up to University level. George intends to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 36-year-old married lady. She has been in the business of making jewellery boxes for 12 years. She has tremendous skill in doing it. Initially she made boxes for her friends and relatives, but now she has become renowned in her community, catering to a large number of customers.  

Azra makes enough money to provide for her family. Her husband also helps her in completing her customer's orders on time. In order to grow her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and asked for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees to purchase a stock of hard boards and cardboard, as well as bundles of velvet and foams to increase her sales. She expects to grow her net income using the loan, and wants to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of hard boards and cardboard, as well as bundles of velvet and foams.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from the Zugdidi district of West Georgia. She is 48 years old, and lives with her retired parents and her son, who is of school age. The only source of income for the family is the monthly retirement pensions received by Nino’s parents. The family lives in poverty, and gets little social assistance from the local government.

As their existing funds are not enough for the normal standard of living, Nino decided to start a trading business using a loan. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Nino applied for a loan from MFO Credo. Her request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.

Nino plans to buy clothes, and sell them among her community with a price mark-up. Part of the loan will be used for buying nuts. The price of nuts is low now because it is the harvest season. She store them for four or five months, then sell them after the price increases. Nino plans to use the profit in the trading business to invest and increase the turnover gradually. She is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to start trading in clothing and nuts

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 40-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she is in her second loan cycle and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees). This will help her to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is 42 years old and is married. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has run a general store at her house for 16 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and household items for selling at her store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 43-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She started her business of a general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy stock of rice and grains along with packs of oil and biscuits to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and grains along with packs of oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 39-year-old married woman, and has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. She has five buffaloes and one cow in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She has five children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable pricing and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the wholesale market. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) form Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of four school-going children. She stays in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Margaret has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by customers in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil for resale. She joined Yehu for financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil for resale.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Anwar needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Anwar has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 37 years old and is married with two sons. Her husband earns money by selling waste stuffs. Huong has been running a general store in front of her door for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and household items to stock her store.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Sophia  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Whindo near Takoradi. She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for two years. Sophia is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Sophia  wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Sophia  plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: purchase a greater quantity of maize to make more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena, age 30, is a married woman; she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  She offers various goods for daily use. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm fruit, and palm oil in Whindo (near Cape Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years.  Elizabeth is married and has one child. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees.  Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm fruit and palm oil. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm fruit and palm oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 46 years old. She is a married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nargis was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family; Nargis felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards.

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. She has requested 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees), and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
Yvoty se formo con la unión de 13 mujeres, todas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras de la ciudad de Caacupe, cada una esta con un gran entusiasmo de ir aprendiendo nuevas estrategias para aplicar a sus emprendimientos.
Un ejemplo que podemos mencionar es la Sra. Evelia, quien además de su trabajo individual, también es la tesorera del grupo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, y la cual empezó con mucho sacrificio, y gracias a lo cual esta ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, bebidas, comestibles y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder ofrecer a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Yvoty is made up of 13 hard working and tenacious women from the city of Caacupe. Each of one of them is very excited to learn new business strategies to use. 

An example is Evalia who, in addition to working on her own, is treasurer of the communal bank. She’s a very hard working person. She has a well stocked store that she opened with a lot of sacrifice and with which she’s supporting her family. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, drinks, groceries, and other items to be able to supply her business and offer her clients what they want.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, drink, groceries and other items.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 27-year-old married father of one child; he has been working as a barber since 14 years ago. In 2008, he opened his own barber shop, and he developed it in a well-managed way.

He is a Syrian citizen working and living in Lebanon to provide his family with the best living he hopes they must have. 

Husein is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for a new sink for his shop and for the new iron door and its requested closing accessories, which will provide more security for his business.

This will be his second loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He is in good standing in his paying back history.

Husein is planning to expand his business and diversify his products.

loans.use: to pay for a new sink for his shop and for the new iron door and its requested closing accessories.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Sarah decided to set up her own pastries business in Whindo. With over a years’ worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more flour to make pastries to sell. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a small scale miner, with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to make pastries to sell.

loans.name: Munazza

texts.en: Munazza is a 45-year-old married woman. She has four children, two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family so she started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy a stock of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. So then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Surrya

texts.en: Surrya is a 41-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Babara

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Babara decided to set up her own food business where she cooks a variety of African dishes to sell in Whindo, near Takoradi. With over two years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more food stuff to prepare her dishes  for sale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a mason, with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuff to prepare her dishes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and peas for sale. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area conducive for farming and her primary customers are wholesalers and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge as transportation during the rainy season. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Her business goal is to open a store to sell her produce within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and peas for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area conducive for farming and her primary customers are wholesalers and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge as transportation during the rainy season. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Her business goal is to open a store to sell her produce within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a 51-year-old married woman. One year ago, she started her own business of cloth sales when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Khadija requested a loan of PKR 30,000 loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a new client aged 26 years and is still single. He is dealing in cattle and has 13 years experience, having started the business in 2001. He started the business so he could have a clear source of income. In addition to the cattle trade business, Godfrey grows tea and coffee to get supplementary income to cater for his family's needs. He does the cattle trade business in his rural area in Bushenyi District and hopes to use the UGX 2,000,000 which he applied for to buy more cows for trade. He is a very hard working  and honest man and this has helped him greatly to thrive in the market despite the stiff competition he faces from other people who sell cattle. Foot and mouth disease is another challenge faced by Godfrey since this calls for quarantine and hence he makes losses. However, he hopes to make more profits after buying cattle for trade using the loan money since there is no foot and mouth disease this season.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has been blessed with two children that are currently going to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 
For the past twelve years, she has operated a retail business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 
With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is a married woman with seven children that go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
She is a poultry farmer and sells to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and lack of adequate capital for the continuity of the business.
With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chicken and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and poultry feed.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children who are ages one year and 10 years. She describes herself to be social. She sells clothes and has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are of all types. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 23-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatments and hair weaving etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located in a conducive environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics etc. Her business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is Linda's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of hair weaves and cosmetics to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is a 48-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way, she will be able to sew more dresses on time. She dreams to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons for her sewing business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a 39-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from seven years to 23 years. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a cereals store where he sells cereals i.e maize, beans, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add to his stock of cereals for resale. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful business man. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of cereals for resale

loans.name: Ngenja

texts.en: Ngenja is a 40-year-old married man. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a food stall where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to rent a hotel. His business goal is to open a restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to rent a hotel

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man who started working twelve years ago as a plumber to help his parents in making their living and covering their expenses. He quit school during intermediate level, although he wishes he had the chance to experience more of it.

Today and exactly three years ago, he started working for himself and established his own successful business. He has one employee to help him in responding to customers needs.

Mohamad is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to update his business tools and make necessary decorations to his house.
This is his first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, but he hopes that it will be his first step forward towards future relationships that will lead to business development.

loans.use: to update his business tools and make necessary decorations to his house.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 54-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 19 years to 37 years. 

Jecinta describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and tomatoes etc. to sell. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances and bad weather conditions. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs, for example, seeds and fertilizers etc. She hopes that in the future, she will excell and be able to increase production. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs, for example, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a personal products retail business in the Philippines.
Marilou requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.
Marilou has been in this business for seven years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.
In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosanna works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad (cycle rickshaw) transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Rosanna is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad transportation business.

Rosanna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad (cycle rickshaw).
